message: On Monday, June 26 at 6:00 p.m. Pacific, I will be holding a Telephone Town Hall Meeting. During this call I will be discussing my work to hold the Trump Administration accountable, strengthen public education, and help working families get ahead. I look forward to answering your questions.   Pre-registration for this event has now closed. If you would like to participate, please call 888-476-4201 on Monday, June 26 at 6:00pm Pacific.

It’s an honor to return to Congress representing Northwest Oregon, one of our nation’s most innovative and economically diverse regions. I will continue to stand up for policies that support working families, increase opportunities for American workers and businesses, strengthen public education, protect our environment, and support seniors and the vulnerable.

This session there is more diversity in Congress, but less than 20 percent of the members are women. Today I was proud to stand with the Democratic women of the House to highlight our progress. Congress will better serve the American people when it accurately represents the population.

We must not go back to the days when health insurance companies discriminated against women. Under the Affordable Care Act, women cannot be charged higher premiums simply because of their gender. And under the #ACA, women have better access to primary and preventive care. Repealing the ACA would take away those protections. #ProtectOurCare

Today the vote of the electoral college was certified in the House Chamber. Although I am deeply disappointed with the results of the election, I will stand my ground to advocate for policies that promote tolerance and equality. To move our country forward we will need to work together on behalf of all of our constituents, and I will be doing just that.
All presidential nominees should be held to the same high standards, including undergoing complete ethics and background checks before their confirmation hearings.

Today the House passed the bipartisan bill I've been working on to improve weather forecasting and research. More accurate and timely weather forecasts will help NW Oregonians decide when to harvest their crops, when to go to sea to fish, and how to prepare for possible flood conditions. I’m proud to see this progress, and hope the Senate passes the bill soon.

People on the coast need better tsunami warnings so they can make it to safety. We must do more to help coastal communities prepare. I’m proud to re-introduce my Tsunami Warning, Education, and Research Act with a great group of bipartisan colleagues.

It is tragic that we've already lost four Oregonians to this unusually cold and snowy winter. Please call 911 if you see someone in need of immediate assistance, and call 211 or visit 211info.org for shelter info. Road conditions are dangerous, so please check road closures, use chains where required, and exercise caution if you must travel. #WinterStorm #WinterSafety

President-elect Trump’s press conference raised a lot of questions. Turning his business operations over to his sons abandons the longstanding presidential practice of placing assets in a blind trust and divesting from personal business dealings. I’m proud to support the Presidential Conflict of Interests Act, which would require a blind trust. Americans deserve to know that the President will focus on keeping the nation secure and improving the lives of Americans, not on his own financial interests.

I help take care of my 88-year-old mom, so I know how important access to health care is for seniors. Because of the Affordable Care Act, Medicare enrollees have lower prescription drug costs, free preventive care, and more coordinated care. We must not dismantle the #ACA. #ProtectOurCare

Repealing the Affordable Care Act without a replacement will endanger health coverage for millions of people. One of them is Mark from Tualatin. We need to make health care more affordable and accessible, not take it away from people who need it. #ProtectOurCare

As we reflect today on Dr. Martin Luther King's legacy, it was an honor to join the Q Center and HRC Portland to assemble care packages for homeless LGBTQ youth. As Dr. King said: "Life’s most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'"

The testimony of Betsy DeVos at her confirmation hearing to be the next Secretary of Education gives me extreme concern about the future of public education in a Trump administration. A Secretary of Education should be committed to strengthening public education, not to dismantling, defunding, or privatizing it.

It was difficult to say goodbye to President Barack Obama and Vice President Biden 44 at the Inauguration today. As this new administration begins, I will continue fighting for Oregon priorities like public education, economic fairness, equity, access to affordable health care, and protecting the planet.

Too many student loan borrowers are struggling to afford their payments. We need clear, uniform servicing standards and strong oversight of loan servicers so these borrowers can access the protections and income-driven repayment options available to them under the law. My bipartisan SIMPLE Act will make it easier to enroll in income-driven repayment plans and have affordable payments.

One of the first bills the House voted on in the Trump Administration doesn't create jobs, strengthen public schools, or help working families save for retirement. Instead the House voted to  restrict access to abortion. This weekend I marched with millions of women across the country to demand that our voices be heard. Congress must listen. #whyimarch

Immigrants are our neighbors, co-workers, friends, and family members. Turning our backs on refugees fleeing war and violence is against our American values. I stand with our vibrant immigrant and refugee communities against President Trump’s actions, and will continue to work for commonsense and compassionate comprehensive immigration reform.

It's more important than ever for scientists to engage fully in public discussions and policy decisions. Today at Science Talk NW I encouraged scientists to be persistent and creative, run for office, and join the upcoming March for Science to make their voices heard. #DefendScience
NA

An Education Secretary should care about all students and advance the promise of an equal, world-class education for every child in this country. Betsy DeVos fails that test. Our children deserve better.

The Unity Center is an impressive new collaboration to provide emergency and in-patient psychiatric care. This innovative partnership reflects Oregon and Portland’s approach to solving the problems we face. Step one is to do no harm, and that means I’ll be doing everything I can to keep the Affordable Care Act in place and advocate for access to mental health care.

On Holocaust Remembrance Day, President Trump issued an offensive and dangerous ban on refugees that targets Muslim-majority countries. It imposes a religious test that is a slap in the face to the principle of religious freedom that is enshrined in the U.S. Constitution. This xenophobic action will fuel anti-American hatred around the world, making us less safe. I stand with my Muslim friends and neighbors, and call on everyone who values religious liberty to join us in opposition.

Our country should be welcoming those fleeing war and persecution, not slamming the door in their faces. Thank you to the ACLU for the successful court victory blocking part of the executive order, but we still have work to do. If you know someone arriving at PDX airport from a country that is a part of the ban, please call ACLU of Oregon at 971-412-2258 or email info@aclu-or.org.
Turning our backs on refugees betrays our American values and doesn't make our country safer. I am speaking out and fighting back against this harmful and unconstitutional Executive Order #nobanpdx

Every year PDX airport welcomes visitors, tourists, and vetted refugees from all over the world. Friday’s discriminatory Executive Order created a crisis among federal agencies, spurred protests around the country, and left families in limbo. I’ll work hard in Congress to make sure our country is safe and that we uphold the American value of religious freedom. No #MuslimBan.

Still need health insurance coverage for 2017? Tuesday, January 31 is the deadline to enroll. It takes about 10 minutes to apply at HealthCare.gov and see how you qualify for financial help and lower monthly premiums.  Share this post to make sure your family, friends, and neighbors get coverage in time!

It's an honor to be elected to be the Vice Ranking Member by my Democratic colleagues on the House Education and the Workforce Committee. With this leadership position, I’ll fight for well-rounded public education that prepares students for college or career, affordable higher education, living wage jobs, and an economy that works for everyone.

The Affordable Care Act has made quality, affordable health care a right – not a privilege – for hundreds of thousands of Oregonians. Debra from Rainier called my office to explain how repealing the ACA would cause her to lose her health care coverage. I remember Debra and others in the same situation as I oppose the reckless attempts to repeal the ACA without a viable replacement plan.

To some people, “school choice” means using public dollars for private and parochial education. Not me. I oppose the use of public money for private schools. It’s especially concerning because private schools do not need to serve all students and often families need to give up the civil rights protections in federal laws. What we do need, however, is more choice within the public school system. The Beaverton School District is a model, where students can enroll in several different magnet schools and public charter schools without signing away their rights to federal civil rights protections or giving up transparency on student achievement.

We should do all we can to make sure that Oregon workers - and all workers - get a safe job site and a fair day’s pay for a fair day’s work. Today I spoke out against a House attempt to roll back reasonable regulations designed to stop taxpayer dollars from going to contractors who violate labor laws.

Fatemeh is not a terrorist. She is a baby with an urgent need for open-heart surgery. But President Trump’s Executive Order is keeping Fatemeh out of our country and away from the life-saving care she needs. Keeping four-month-old babies out of our country doesn’t make us safer; it puts her life in danger and diminishes the United States in the eyes of the world.

I’m thrilled to report that baby Fatemeh will be coming to Oregon for her surgery!  The request my colleagues and I made for a waiver and the work of many volunteer immigration attorneys all came together late yesterday. I wish Fatemeh safe travels, a successful surgery, and a full recovery. This outpouring of support for a child in need shows America at its finest.

A federal district judge has blocked President Trump’s hasty and un-American order banning refugees and immigrants from seven Muslim countries. I hope that the tens of thousands of families caught in crisis by this order can reunite safely. This discriminatory order has already harmed families and tarnished our reputation abroad.

I’m excited to be the new Co-Chair of the bipartisan Congressional Oceans Caucus, and look forward to working with Co-Chair Don Young from Alaska. Today we discussed the importance of improving ocean health, reducing ocean acidification, getting better warning for tsunami events, and using science to make decisions.

I’m deeply disappointed that the Senate has confirmed Betsy DeVos to be the Secretary of Education. I share the serious concerns raised by hundreds of thousands of people across the country about her paucity of experience in public education policy and her lack of commitment to strengthening public schools and enforcing critical equity protections for students. As Vice Ranking Member of the House Education Committee, I will look for opportunities to work with Secretary DeVos to deliver on the promise of an equal, world-class public education for every child in this country. But I will use every tool at my disposal to oppose efforts to privatize public education or to undermine the important role of federal policy in protecting the civil rights of all students. If this Secretary and her allies in Congress propose legislation to shift public school funding to private and religious schools, or to weaken oversight of the law that prohibits gender discrimination in education, or to ignore the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, I will be on the front lines of the fight to defend the rights of all students to high-quality public education.

The mission of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is to protect human health and the environment, and because of the EPA we have clean air and water across the country. Today the House Science Committee held a hearing titled “Making EPA Great Again.” Instead of discussing how and why the EPA should fight climate change, the hearing instead attacked the research the EPA uses to make decisions. What a lost opportunity. #DefendScience #DefendEPA

I’m very relieved to learn that baby Fatemeh and her parents have arrived safely in Oregon. Thank you to Oregon Health & Science University (OHSU) for their continued commitment to care for Fatemeh throughout her difficult journey. The outpouring of support from the community and offers of help from so many across the country show the true heart of our nation. We help one another; we do not close doors to a four-month-old baby in need of life-saving heart surgery who poses no threat to our nation’s security.   As a mom, I know that parents will do everything they can to care for their children. Fatemeh will now receive world-class care at OHSU with her family and community supporting her. Let’s honor the family’s request for privacy, and send them our best wishes for a successful procedure and speedy recovery for Fatemeh.  http://www.oregonlive.com/portland/index.ssf/2017/02/iranian_baby_girl_with_heart_d_1.html

When I worked my way through community college, university, and law school, it was possible for students to earn a degree with a manageable amount of debt. Today too many students and graduates struggle to make ends meet. The House Committee on Education and the Workforce Committee discussed how to make higher education more affordable and accessible this week.

The 9th Circuit of Appeals just ruled unanimously against President Trump’s hasty and harmful ban on refugees and immigrants from Muslim countries. The decision affirms that this order was overly broad and is not necessary for our national safety. I’m relieved that the court upheld our Constitutional commitment to religious freedom and equal treatment of all people.

I was proud to stand and march for human rights with the diverse community in Washington County today. When I was sworn into Congress, I took my oath on the Constitution because I recognize that I represent everyone - whether they pray in a mosque, church, synagogue, or not at all, and whether they find spiritual guidance in a Bible, Quran, or Torah or in nature, art, or the eyes of a child. Diversity and freedom of religion make our nation stronger.

Credible sources say that National Security Advisor Michael Flynn discussed changes to U.S. policy with a Russian ambassador before President Trump took office, and then lied to the Vice President. That’s alarming, and, if confirmed, violates federal law. I call on President Trump to revoke Flynn’s security credentials and relieve him of his duties immediately.

Happy Oregon Statehood Day! Every day it's an honor to represent Northwest Oregon, one of our nation’s most innovative and economically diverse regions that leads the way in family-friendly workplace policies and protecting our environment.

To address cybersecurity challenges, we need to develop and educate a modern, innovative workforce. There is tremendous potential for community and technical colleges to participate in this important effort. We should be encouraging public-private partnerships to build our cybersecurity defenses.

Everyone deserves to retire with dignity. Instead of helping more people save for retirement, today Congress voted to repeal a rule that supports state efforts like OregonSaves. I reintroduced the #AmericanSavingsAct with Jared Huffman to create a national program modeled on Oregon’s leadership to give every worker across the country the opportunity to save for a secure retirement.

Once again Congress is making it more difficult for low-income women to access primary and preventive health care services like well-women exams and cancer screenings. Investing in #TitleX family planning saves taxpayers money. Instead of blocking access to affordable health care, Congress should be focusing on keeping our nation safe, creating jobs, and expanding opportunities for working families. #StandwithPP

I am deeply disappointed that the Senate confirmed Scott Pruitt to serve as the Administrator for the Environmental Protection Agency. Instead of steering our country toward forward-thinking climate change solutions, Pruitt will drag us back to the days of polluted rivers and dirty air. I’ll do everything I can to protect the environment and our families from pollution.

75 years ago today, President Roosevelt signed an Executive Order forcing 120,000 Japanese Americans to leave their homes and businesses and report to internment camps with barbed wire fences. Oregonians like Minoru Yasui courageously protested the order. The federal government didn't apologize to the survivors until 1988. We must never allow something like that to happen again.

A bright spot in Congress last week was casting my vote for the BRAVE Act, which will encourage more companies to hire veterans by allowing the VA to give preference to companies with high numbers of veteran employees when awarding contracts. And the Senate unanimously confirmed a well-respected public servant, David Shulkin, to lead the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs. We can all agree that our veterans deserve our support.

Tearing apart immigrant families betrays our values and does not make us any safer. It is vital that immigrants in our community and around the country know their rights. #EndICERaids   Please share this info widely.   https://www.aclu.org/know-your-rights/what-do-if-immigration-agents-ice-are-your-door

All students deserve to learn in a safe and compassionate environment. I strongly condemn the Trump Administration’s attempt to unravel protections from sex discrimination for transgender students. I will do all that I can to defend the right of all students to learn in schools that are safe and free from discrimination.

Please join me in celebrating Black History Month and the rich and diverse contributions African Americans have made to Oregon and our country. Now more than ever, we must work together for equity, justice, and equality.

New research affirms that school vouchers have a negative effect on student achievement. There is no reason the federal government should to be funneling much-needed public school funding to private and religious schools. As a leader on the Education Committee, I will stand up for the right of every child in this country to have access to an equal, world-class public education.
I’ll be broadcasting on Facebook LIVE following President Trump’s Address to Congress. Joining me will be Portland Community College President Mitsui. Tune in on Tuesday night!

The Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act was signed into law 24 years ago. Background checks save lives by blocking domestic abusers, felons, and dangerous individuals from purchasing firearms. But to be effective, we need accurate records and strong enforcement. Congress should #TalkAboutGuns and how we can keep our communities safe.
After President Trump’s address to Congress, join Portland Community College President Mitsui and me for a discussion on Facebook Live.

A budget is a statement of our shared values. President Trump is proposing a significant increase in military spending and large cuts to diplomacy. We all want the country to be safe, but this proposal is misguided. Smarter investments in intelligence and cybersecurity without cutting the State Department budget will make us safer. Slashing the budgets for the EPA and programs that support working families will take our country in the wrong direction.
Congresswoman Bonamici and Portland Community College President Mitsui host discussion following President Trump’s address to Congress.

Thank you to my guest, PCC President Mark Mitsui, for joining me in Washington, D.C., and for his thoughtful reflections on tonight's speech by President Trump. The President mentioned a few things like infrastructure investment and affordable childcare that might earn bipartisan support, but without policy proposals his words were just empty promises. His demonization of immigrants was offensive, and I will fight back against his threats to repeal the Affordable Care Act, his plan to privatize public education, and his pledge to significantly increase defense spending while cutting the budgets for diplomacy and environmental protection. President Trump stayed on script tonight, but it’s his actions that matter. I will uphold Oregon values and hold the President and his Administration accountable every step of the way. #jointsession

Last night the President told Congress his vision about improving our nation, but today it's business as usual. The American people want a strong economy and a secure future, not fewer consumer protections. I’m disappointed that the House passed a bill that threatens consumer protections and other important rules, and rejected my amendment to protect student loan borrowers who have been misled by unscrupulous institutions.

There’s so much going on in our country now, and I’m looking forward to hearing your thoughts, ideas, and questions. I’m holding town hall meetings in every county I represent, starting Friday, March 3rd in McMinnville. You can find all of the details at the link. Please join me, and share this information with your friends and neighbors.

Reports are now clear that Attorney General Jeff Sessions misled the Senate Judiciary Committee during his confirmation hearing. He can no longer be trusted to lead the nation’s top law enforcement agency. Leading the Department of Justice requires honesty, truth, and transparency. Jeff Sessions must resign.
Just discovered a great local treasure, Blue Raeven Pie Farmstand in Amity. Pies and treats look delicious. #SupportSmallBusiness

It was great to see McMinnville Area Habitat for Humanity’s newest construction site today. There’s a housing crisis in many communities in Northwest Oregon, and efforts like this help.  I’ll continue to support federal funding that helps families in need gain access to affordable housing.

Thanks to everyone who joined us in McMinnville tonight to talk about your ideas and concerns. It was a great discussion and a very engaged crowd! I’ll be holding five more town hall meetings in the coming weeks, so please join me in your community.

Interested in learning about the work of Congress? My Beaverton and Washington, D.C. offices are seeking interns for the summer term. Interns gain valuable experience doing legislative research and supporting staff with constituent communication while learning about the operations of a congressional office. We are committed to assigning interns to policy areas that interest them. High school seniors, college students, and recent graduates are encouraged to apply. Applications for the summer term are accepted on a rolling basis with preference given to those who apply by March 17th. To apply, please visit: http://bonamici.house.gov/internshipform

Don’t be fooled – President Trump has just repackaged his ban on refugees and immigrants from Muslim-majority countries. Blocking refugees who are fleeing war and persecution is un-American and unacceptable.

The proposal from Republican leadership to gut the #AffordableCareAct is unacceptable. It will result in less coverage and higher costs for working families, it makes it harder for low-income individuals to access health care, and it defunds Planned Parenthood. I oppose this and any health care bill that will not improve health care for Oregonians.

Join Congresswoman Suzanne Bonamici for a Town Hall meeting in Yamhill!  Town Hall meetings provide an opportunity for the Congresswoman to discuss issues, answer questions, and gather ideas.  Yamhill Town Hall Meeting  Date: Monday, September 18, 2017 Time: 6:00pm Location: Yamhill Carlton Intermediate School, Gym – 310 E Main Street, Yamhill, OR 97148  To stay up to date on future town hall meetings, please subscribe to the Bonamici Bulletin monthly e-newsletter: https://bonamici.house.gov/contact/newsletter

Today, and every day, I stand in solidarity with women across the world who strive for equality. Women can’t get ahead until they have full access to health care, equal pay for equal work, and fair workplace policies. Nearly a century ago, women fought for the right to vote. More than fifty years ago, women took control of their reproductive health care. And yet today, women are still demanding that our voices be heard.  Across Oregon, the nation, and the world, women are striking in solidarity to demonstrate their economic contributions. It’s 2017, and it's my hope that - from today forward - we finally recognize the many contributions of women and the wide-ranging benefits that come from true equality. #InternationalWomensDay

The ACA provides health care coverage for millions of Americans, but it also gives people like my constituent Andrea the freedom of knowing they have coverage regardless of their employment situation. But today the House Education and the Workforce Committee took steps to roll back critical consumer protections for employees who have employer-based health insurance plans. I oppose any efforts that do not improve or expand health care coverage for Oregonians and Americans.

I delivered a pick-me-up to my colleague Congressman Kurt Schrader, who has been working through the night as the Trump/Ryan bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act is rushed through the House. Oregonians don't want a health care bill that raises costs, weakens Medicaid and Medicare, and reduces coverage for working families. Thanks, Kurt, for standing strong for Oregon!

People often ask me what Congress is doing about renewable energy and ocean acidification, and how we are addressing climate change. Unfortunately, the Science Committee majority is more interested in questioning the data behind rules that protect clean air and water. Exacerbating the challenge is Trump's EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt, who said that carbon dioxide isn't a primary contributor to global warming. The House Science Committee needs to get back to protecting the environment!

I'm glad to hear that Oregon joined a multi-state legal challenge to Trump’s new executive order banning refugees and immigrants from Muslim countries. The ban betrays our values and our nation's commitment to religious freedom and equal treatment.
Join me tonight for a town hall meeting in Hillsboro. Details below:

The Trump/Ryan proposal to gut Obamacare would leave 14 million people without health insurance by 2018, according to the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office. That's unacceptable, and would have devastating consequences for families all over the country. Today's report is just one more reason why I continue to oppose this harmful legislation.
Thank you to Basic Rights Oregon for convening an important discussion about how we can support transgender students and their families.

Thank you to everyone who came to my town hall meeting in Hillsboro. Last week my office received a record amount of calls, emails, and letters. I value the input I get from the people I represent, and the feedback informs the work I do.

Virginia Garcia Memorial Foundation and Health Center provides life-saving care to many in our region. I’m extremely concerned that repealing the Affordable Care Act will raise health care costs and put coverage out of reach for too many Oregonians. We need to improve—not limit—the health care needs of those facing barriers to accessing coverage.
Thank you to the Hillsboro Youth Advisory Council for visiting with me today! Our democracy is stronger when passionate, talented young people are fully engaged.

A budget is a statement of values. With the proposal released today, President Trump is saying more clearly than ever that he does not share the values we hold in Oregon. We invest in our people and our communities because we know we are stronger when we support our schools, infrastructure, and critical safety nets that help working families succeed and seniors thrive. This budget shows a complete disregard for the challenges we face as a nation and world. By slashing the Environmental Protection Agency, we will continue to fall behind in curbing climate change and preserving clean air and drinking water. Reducing investments in the State Department undermines decades of diplomatic efforts that have both made our country a global leader and reduced threats of war and terrorism. Diverting precious dollars away from our public schools to failed voucher programs will leave too many students without the knowledge and skills they need to get ahead. Eliminating the National Endowment for the Arts is short-sighted and counterproductive; their small investments go directly into our local communities and grow our economy. And outrageously, these cuts are proposed so the President can needlessly increase defense spending.  This budget is not only immoral; it is unrealistic and Congress must reject it.   I will not allow the President's dangerous budget proposal to go unchallenged, and I will continue to fight these massive and destructive cuts. We must reject this budget and focus on growing our economy to bring good jobs and stability to our communities and families, on protecting our planet for future generations, and on keeping our country safe with smarter investments in cybersecurity and intelligence. This budget fails to accomplish anything but generating headlines for the President. #TrumpCuts

Republicans have held ZERO hearings on their replacement for the Affordable Care Act. Hearings are an important part of the legislative process and allow Congress to hear from experts and carefully consider legislation. Today House Democrats convened a forum to hear from experts about the Trump/Ryan replacement. I asked how the bill will affect vulnerable Oregonians, and the response is alarming. I will oppose any bill that does not improve access, especially for those facing barriers to coverage. Watch my remarks at the 2hr 22min mark in the link below.

When I worked at Legal Aid in Oregon, I saw firsthand how critical their services are for millions of Americans who need help getting access to justice and navigating the legal system. The President’s proposed elimination of Legal Service Corporation is unconscionable. Legal Aid attorneys help women fleeing domestic violence secure restraining orders, help families facing foreclosure from losing everything they’ve worked for, and assist older Americans who are facing elder abuse.  I will fight this short-sighted attempt to gut legal services for low-income and vulnerable people in our communities.
During my time in public service, I’ve worked on building collaboration and consensus. I’m proud to sign the DC Bully Busters pledge to not engage in or be a bystander to bullying in Congress.

Seven transgender women of color have been murdered this year in the US. This epidemic of violence is heartbreaking and terrifying, and I stand with the trans community in grief and solidarity. Transgender people deserve to live their lives in peace, and I will continue to work for an end to anti-trans violence and discrimination. #ProtectTransWomen

This week the House is expected to vote on the Trump/Ryan health care bill, which will take health insurance coverage away from tens of thousands of people I represent. I strongly oppose this bill, and will vote no. We should be working together to find ways to improve, not restrict, access to health care. Here on my Facebook page I’ll be sharing some of the stories I’ve heard from NW Oregonians about how their health depends on keeping the Affordable Care Act.    In Astoria, Thomas and Marina are in their 60s. Because they’ve each had joints replaced, they are considered to have pre-existing conditions. Under the Trump/Ryan plan, people like Thomas and Marina could end up being charged much more for health insurance - that's not affordable and it's not access. Without the Affordable Care Act, Thomas says, “we would be broke and uninsured.” Thomas is counting the days until he turns 65 and is eligible for Medicare: 381 to go. Without health insurance, they would not be able to manage their health and they fear they would lose their home if one of them becomes sick

The House Intelligence Committee held a hearing about the Trump Administration’s alleged connections with Russia. It's about time. Director Comey’s confirmation that the FBI is investigating collusion during the election shows the need for a transparent, thorough investigation. Congress must fully investigate any foreign efforts to influence our elections.

Funding for the arts and humanities is under assault. The President has proposed eliminating the National Endowment for the Arts, National Endowment for the Humanities, and Corporation for Public Broadcasting. Federal investments in the arts strengthen local economies. As co-founder and co-chair of the bipartisan Congressional STEAM Caucus, I know the tremendous power the arts hold in educating the next generation of innovative thinkers. I’m proud to join Democratic Whip Steny Hoyer, Americans for the Arts, and many successful artists for #artsadvocacy so the arts and our culture continue to thrive across the country.

I worked my way through community college, university, and law school, and graduated with a manageable amount of debt. The Federal Work Study Program helped me, and today it helps students pay for their education while giving them real-world experience. I’m committed to strengthening the Federal Work Study Program so more students can participate, reduce their student loan debts, and enter the workforce ready to be successful.

Here’s the story of another NW Oregonian who benefited from the Affordable Care Act. In Hillsboro at the Virginia Garcia Memorial Foundation and Health Center, I heard about a patient who was diagnosed with liver cancer during a routine exam. Without insurance, the patient was skeptical about pursing treatment. The devoted staff at Virginia Garcia walked the patient through applying for #OregonHealthPlan. Because the Affordable Care Act expanded Medicaid, more Oregonians are covered. OHP gave the patient hope and the willingness to fight cancer.    #Trumpcare will limit Medicaid coverage for low-income individuals and families. And it would restrict Medicaid recipients from receiving life-saving preventive care and screenings at Planned Parenthood. This is the wrong approach to making our country healthier, and will mean higher costs for everyone.

Oregon Trio helps first-generation students, low-income students, and students with disabilities prepare for and succeed in higher education. Oregon and America are stronger when students are given the support and resources they need to complete school and chart their path to a successful career and life. TRIO Programs are a great investment.  #TrioWorks

We need an independent commission to investigate the Trump campaign and Trump Administration's connections with Russia. The House Intelligence Committee has responsibility to provide oversight of the US Intelligence agencies, but the Chair of the committee has shown that he's not neutral.

#Breaking News - The House will NOT vote on #TrumpCare today. This bill is being written and negotiated behind closed doors with no hearings, no way for the public to know what’s in it, and no idea how much it would cost. We do know people will pay more and get less, and it's especially bad for seniors. House leadership needs to go back to the drawing board and find a way to improve access to affordable health care.
#BREAKINGNEWS – House Leadership again cancelled a vote on #TrumpCare. This is what happens when Americans speak up, call their members of Congress, and demand that their voices be heard.

#TrumpCare would be a disaster, and I’m glad the bill was pulled before a vote on the floor. Oregonians would pay more and get less. It’s especially bad for seniors, who would see their rates increase significantly. The bill eliminated several important consumer protections the Affordable Care Act added to insurance, like coverage for mental health care and making sure that women have coverage for maternity care and cancer screenings. I was planning to vote no because this bill would have dire consequences for so many people in Oregon and nationwide. Read more below.

Today the House passed Peter DeFazio’s bill to make Pacific Northwest communities safer and better prepared for earthquakes. In NW Oregon we know that improving early warning systems and making infrastructure investments now means we can save lives and property later.

President Obama was serious about addressing greenhouse gas emissions to curb climate change. He showed leadership by implementing the Clean Power Plan and signing the historic Paris Agreement.   Today President Trump turned the clock back, weakened US leadership, and sent us on a path that will exacerbate climate change. That's bad for our country and our planet. #DefendClimate

I’m disappointed that the House passed a bill that will allow corporations to sell consumers’ personal information without permission. Consumers have the right to protect their private internet browsing history. #BroadbandPrivacy

Climate change is real, and the House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology should be discussing ways to curb it. People around the globe are facing threats from rising sea levels, oceans becoming more acidic, more frequent and severe weather events, record droughts and flooding, and rising global temperatures. I hope the day comes soon when the Committee and Congress can work on solutions to climate change rather than debating its existence. #DefendClimate

I'm proud to join Planned Parenthood’s #PinkOut. I #StandwithPP because of the women and men in Oregon and around the country who receive life-saving cancer screenings, contraceptive counseling, and preventive care. Our communities are healthier because of Planned Parenthood.

Unfortunately, the Department of Education has rescinded its guidance protecting struggling student loan borrowers from exorbitant collection fees. I am encouraged to hear that student debt collectors will disregard the Department’s harmful decision and continue to exempt borrowers who take prompt action to cure their defaulted loans from excessive fees. We should be making repayment easier for vulnerable borrowers, not adding to their debts.

Recent ICE action has been aggressive and mean-spirited, and it does not improve the safety of our communities. I’m introducing the Protecting #SensitiveLocationsAct to keep ICE out of sensitive locations and make sure immigrant families can take their kids to school, go to worship, or seek protective orders and police assistance.  More information here: http://bonamici.house.gov/press-release/espaillat-bonamici-serrano-beyer-introduce-protecting-sensitive-locations-act

Today I hosted a desperately needed conversation with Earl Blumenauer, Multnomah County Chair Deborah Kafoury, Judge Nan Waller, immigration advocates, and community leaders about the Protecting #SensitiveLocationsAct I introduced yesterday. Our immigrant communities need to be safe and feel secure when accessing justice, seeking education and health care, and practicing their faith.

Congratulations to the Hot Wired Robotics FIRST Tech Challenge Team on winning the Inspire Award at the 2016 World Championship! It was terrific to see your robot in action today. Good luck in Houston!

The Trump administration is attacking environmental protection, renewable energy, and our economic future. Fortunately Oregon advocates are pushing back—and innovating and collaborating at the local and state level to advance environmental priorities. Thanks The Nature Conservancy in Oregon, Coalition of Oregon Land Trusts, North Coast Land Conservancy, Sustainable Northwest, and Willamette Partnership for your important collaborative efforts to protect the environment while growing the economy.
The Oregon Congressional Delegation says #GoDucks!
Honored to join House Democrats Chairman Rep. Joe Crowley to talk about #EqualPayDay and helping working families thrive. Tune in below!

Today is when the average earnings of an American woman catch up to what a man earned in 2016. The wage gap for women of color is even greater. I’m proud to support the #PaycheckFairnessAct and will keep working hard to implement solutions to the challenges faced by women and working families. #EqualPayDay

Preparing for tsunami and improving our tsunami warning systems is a life-or-death matter. Congress took an important step forward today by passing bipartisan legislation to strengthen tsunami forecasting and notification systems. Passing this legislation was one of my first priorities when I came to Congress, and I’m glad it finally passed and will help coastal communities in Oregon and around the country.

Here's another victory for equality! A federal court ruled that the 1964 Civil Rights Act protects our LGBTQ friends and neighbors from employment discrimination. Treating employees based on their merit will level the playing field and is good for business.

Thank you to The Nature Conservancy in Oregon for leading the way on #ClimateChange. It's time for all of us to work together toward a healthier and more sustainable future. There is so much we can accomplish, despite the Trump administration’s continued attacks on the environment.

I condemn in the strongest possible terms the ongoing attacks on civilians in Syria, and especially condemn the use of chemical weapons. President Assad’s history of brutality against his own people has created a desperate humanitarian crisis with implications around the world. The international community must address the blatant war crimes being committed in Syria and work together to provide additional aid and shelter to the refugees of this horrific conflict.  The decision to use our military in conflicts overseas is complex. Although the U. S. response taken yesterday was done without Congressional input or approval, which raises serious questions, it is imperative that the Trump Administration adhere to U.S. law and seek Congressional authorization for any further use of military force. President Trump’s policy on involvement in Syria and in conflicts across the globe has been erratic. He must now present a clear plan to Congress and to the American people before moving forward with any other action.  I also call for the Trump Administration to reconsider the short-sighted decision to close U.S. borders to desperate refugees seeking shelter, and I strongly urge the Administration to reverse its proposal to slash the State Department’s diplomatic budgets. Our country must work with our international allies to create stability in the region with a comprehensive approach to ending violence, providing humanitarian aid, and dismantling ISIS.

With the threat of #ClimateChange, it’s more important than ever that we invest in scientists who are examining the effects of climate change on our oceans. At Oregon State University Hatfield Marine Science Center, professors partner with federal researchers to investigate serious issues like ocean acidification. As Congress plans the federal budget, I’ll continue to fight for investment in sound science and collaborative partnerships. #ProtectOurOceans

The promise of a quality public education for all students is one of the core values of our country. I appreciate the many dedicated #STEM and #STEAM educators in Oregon who are helping more students succeed in school and beyond. It was great talking with some of these teachers and leaders at the Oregon Coast STEM Hub Convening.

Oregon's diverse and sustainable fisheries fuel our coastal economies—and keep us well-fed. I enjoyed touring Pacific Seafood in Newport and look forward to the day when their new Warrenton facility opens.

My Beaverton office is currently accepting submissions for the 2017 #CongressionalArtCompetition. All students in grades 9-12 who reside in or attend school in the First Congressional District are encouraged to participate! The deadline for submissions is Friday, April 28, 2017. For more info visit http://bonamici.house.gov/art.

While President Trump continues to hide his tax returns, millions of Americans are preparing to file theirs—and unfortunately the complicated process creates an opportunity for some unscrupulous tax preparers to take advantage of them. People should not have to face hidden fees or worry about being overcharged. My Tax Refund Protection Act includes multiple safeguards that require preparers to behave ethically.

The National Sea Grant College Program invests resources in local communities to help us better understand our oceans, educate and engage young people, and stimulate economic development on the coast.  By leveraging additional resources, Oregon Sea Grant has an even broader reach. I’ll continue working to protect Sea Grant funding from the Trump Administration’s short-sighted proposed cuts.

Beverly Cleary is an Oregon author beloved around the world, and it’s fitting that her birthday is “Drop Everything And Read” day. Take a moment to celebrate her and catch up with Ramona or any of Cleary’s wonderful books today! #DEARDay #BeverlyCleary

It was an honor to award the Senator Mark O. Hatfield architecture scholarship today to William Chandler. Many of the challenges we face, such as the housing crisis, disaster preparedness, and climate change, involve changing the built environment. The architecture industry has a long history of innovation and problem solving and is well prepared to lead the way on these challenges and more.
I’m pleased to see Emmanuel Ayala Frutos released from ICE custody to get treatment for his injuries and recover with family. We need comprehensive immigration reform in our country.

It was exciting to join Mayor Ted Wheeler and Energy Trust of Oregon to help flip the switch on one of Portland’s largest solar installations. This new 1 megawatt project at Montgomery Park will produce about one million kilowatt hours of clean, carbon-free, solar power annually!

The Trump administration’s attacks on climate science are alarming. As the top Democrat on the Environment Subcommittee I’m doing everything I can to stand up for science and commonsense solutions to climate change. Oregon is a leader on climate change, thanks in part to the leadership of Oregon League of Conservation Voters. It was great to gather with OLCV supporters tonight to talk about how we can continue to advance our goals at the state and local level.
Please join me for town hall meetings today at Warrenton High School at 11 am and Scappoose High School at 3 pm.  Click here for more details.

Thank you to everyone who joined me at the Warrenton and Scappoose #TownHall meetings. I appreciate your input and share your concerns. Some of the issues we discussed include protecting access to affordable health care, supporting public education, and concerns about President Trump’s approach to Syria and North Korea.

Tonight in Sherwood I enjoyed hearing ideas, thoughts, and concerns from the community at my fifth town hall meeting. There’s one more meeting on Sunday, May 7 at 11 am at Lincoln High School. Please contact my office by phone, email, or letter if you have something you’d like to bring to my attention. I’ll hold another series of town hall meetings later this year.

Everyone should be able to age with dignity and retire with financial security and independence. One of my priorities in Congress is making sure that older Americans have the support and services they need to live healthy, fulfilling, and independent lives. The Tualatin Aging Task Force is leading the way on these issues and is a model of what engaged citizens can accomplish by working together.

All community members should have the opportunity to gain skills that will help them build careers and provide for their families. I enjoyed touring Centro de Prosperidad and learning how the Hillsboro, Oregon and Centro Cultural de Washington County are partnering to support Washington County's diverse workforce.

It’s National Park Week, a great time to explore a National Park Service site near you. Admission will be waived at all National Parks this weekend, April 22-23. #FindYourPark   More information at: www.nationalparkweek.org

Treating all employees with dignity and respect is good business. It was an honor to join Basic Rights Oregon in recognizing Salt & Straw Ice Cream and Wieden+Kennedy for advancing equality for LGBTQ Oregonians. #EqualityforAll

Thank you Virginia Garcia Memorial Foundation and Health Center for convening an important discussion about improving health outcomes for women and children. Oregonians understand and care about women’s health care, reproductive rights, and helping children and families live healthy lives. Unfortunately, those thoughtful and meaningful discussions have been in short supply in Washington, DC. I’m focused on working together to improve – not restrict – access to health coverage.

Oregonians love to be outdoors, and our state has a long tradition of excellence in outerwear, apparel, and related industries. On the Education and the Workforce Committee, I'm working on policies that support a creative, innovative workforce for the 21st Century.  Thanks to the many outdoor retailers like adidas for the great discussion with Representatives Blumenauer and Murphy and me.

Happy #Earth Day, and what a great day to participate in #MarchforScience! In Oregon and across the country, thousands of people are standing up for science and scientific research. As the top Democrat on the Science Committee’s Environment Subcommittee, I’ll keep fighting for research funding and policies that grow our economy while protecting the environment.

Every year communities around the world remember the victims of the Holocaust by publicly reciting their names. Today’s Yom HaShoah ceremony was a solemn reminder that we must always remember the millions of Jews who were killed, and commit to bringing peace to the world. #NeverAgain

Congratulations Constitution Team-Ulysses Grant High School, Portland, OR! They finished second in the national We the People competition by demonstrating their deep and impressive knowledge about the US Constitution and civics. Oregon is proud of you! #WTPFinals

In Congress, I’m committed to working for policies that support working families and increase opportunities for entrepreneurs and businesses. It was inspiring to hear from the women business leaders of MÅURICE, Alma Chocolate, Dame Restaurant, Nostrana, Tournant, and PDX Wines. Thank you for a great discussion about challenges and opportunities facing small business owners.

Congress has until Friday to fund the federal government or face a shutdown. There’s a lot at stake for our communities and the economy. Families can’t afford a late tax refund or any of the other repercussions of a shutdown. I’m calling on Congressional leadership to work together to make sure the federal government stays open.

The rise in hate crimes in the United States is appalling and un-American. Our immigrant populations shape our vibrant communities and support our innovation economy. I stand with Oregon’s Indian American communities in condemning the violence against and murder of Indian Americans in Seattle and Kansas.

Our workplace policies have not kept up with our changing workforce, but the House Education & Workforce Committee has passed a bill that would make the situation worse, not better. The bill would force workers to choose between earning overtime pay or taking comp time to care for sick kids or family members. Congress should be working on meaningful solutions to raise workers’ wages, increase access to paid sick days and family leave, provide flexible and predictable scheduling, and help Americans better balance work and family life.
Best of luck to Westview High School! They have a team competing in the Official National Science Bowl ® for the fourth straight year. Oregon is proud of you!

My own children are grown now, but it was great to have Madison spend the morning with me for #TakeOurDaughtersToCongress. Through mentorship and support from Girls Inc. Madison has become a strong, smart, and bold young woman with a bright future ahead of her!
This year Astoria has set an all-time record for most rainy days—and we’re still counting. One more reason I’m proud to represent Northwest Oregon- the rain makes us hardy!

House leadership has once again postponed a vote on repealing/replacing the Affordable Care Act. Writing legislation behind closed doors and putting it up for a vote without getting input from medical experts and consumers is not how to make good policy. Congress needs to hold public hearings and know the true cost of the bill before any vote on health care, especially when the proposals make coverage less accessible and more expensive for so many Oregonians and Americans.

Here's my statement about President Trump's first 100 days in office. I’ve heard from thousands of constituents across NW Oregon and their message has been clear - protect our democracy and stand up against the dishonesty and harmful policies that are coming from this Administration. Despite all the challenges, I’m encouraged to hear and see so many people across Oregon and the country raising their voices and fully engaging in democracy.

The #PeoplesClimateMarch today is highlighting the need for climate action and environmental justice. Dirty air, polluted rivers, and the negative effects of climate change disproportionately harm communities of color. I stand with marchers today and will continue to work for clean air, clean water, and climate action. #EnvironmentalJustice

Our country has high rates of childhood obesity and chronic health conditions. This is no time to give up on ambitious nutritional standards for school lunches, but that’s what new Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue just did. I’ll be fighting for nutritional standards so growing children get healthy food at school.

Oregon recognizes that everyone deserves to be treated fairly and with respect. But across the country, our LGBTQ friends and neighbors can be fired, evicted, or kicked out of a restaurant or hotel because of who they are or who they love. I’m proud to support the #EqualityAct so everyone in the LGBTQ community has protection from discrimination. History stands on the side of equality and dignity!

Oregonians and Americans need to be able to balance work and family, but the Working Families Flexibility Act won't help. In fact, this bill will take away #overtime pay, and instead, workers would get a vague IOU for comp time sometime in the future. I’ll continue advocating for #schedulesthatwork, paid sick days and paid family leave, and raising stagnant wages so people can better balance work and family life. #lesstimelesspay

As a member of Congress I have the privilege of nominating candidates to military service academy. It was an honor to nominate these talented and bright students from NW Oregon to the United States Naval Academy. Thank you for your commitment to serve our nation.

Today I voted against #TrumpCare, the harmful health care bill, because it puts the most vulnerable people at risk and will be a disaster for Oregonians and Americans. My vote was for the Oregon women who could lose coverage for maternity care and prenatal care, the seniors who could be forced to pay more for coverage, and hundreds of thousands of Oregonians who could lose health care coverage. This is a Republican bill that had no hearings, and we were forced to vote without knowing the cost. It’s bad policy and bad process, and I hope it dies in the Senate.

I am deeply disappointed that the White House is continuing attacks on women’s health and our #LGBTQ friends and neighbors. President Trump’s executive order is a shameful #LicensetoDiscriminate in the name of religion.

Access to housing is important for everyone, and we must do more to address Oregon’s housing crisis. Affordable housing projects that are close to public transportation are an important part of the solution, and I was happy to visit Sunset View Apartments in Beaverton today. Thank you to the community for coming together to make this project a reality.

Please join me tomorrow, May 7th, at 11 am in the gym at Lincoln High School in Portland for a town hall meeting. I'll provide an update on Congress, including the vote on health care, and take questions. Hope to see you there!

Thank you to all of the engaged Oregonians at this afternoon's town hall meeting in Portland. We had a great conversation about the outrageous and harmful health care bill that recently passed the House, protecting public education and the environment, and helping working families succeed.
It's #TeacherAppreciationWeek! #ThankATeacher for the time, effort, and love they pour into helping students succeed.

Thank you Family Forward Action for helping Oregon lead the nation in adapting family-friendly workplace policies. In Congress, I’m working on updating policy to better support workers across the country, including meaningful schedule flexibility, sick days and paid family leave, and raising stagnant wages so Americans can better balance work and family life.

Congratulations Jessica Xiao from Southridge High School for winning my 2017 #CongressionalArtCompetition! Her painting titled ‘Drowning’ will be displayed in the Capitol building for one year. My office received a record number of submissions for the competition, and all of the students did excellent work. The arts are an important part of well-rounded education, and I am committed to supporting arts education in our schools.

The President’s abrupt firing of FBI Director Comey is disturbing. I have spent the last several weeks holding town hall meetings around NW Oregon, and people are understandably outraged about Russia's interference in our election and this administration's connections with Russia.   To restore confidence in government, we must have an independent investigation. It must begin immediately, and the results must be transparent and available to the public.

Efforts to turn back the clock on women’s health care are deeply concerning. I’m proud of Oregon and NARAL Pro-Choice Oregon for leading the nation in supporting reproductive health care and putting women in control of their health care decisions. I’ll continue to stand up for reproductive rights in the U.S. Congress.

It’s National #NursesWeek! Thank you to all of the outstanding nurses in NW Oregon who are on the front lines of our health care system providing quality care and comfort to their patients every day. In Congress, I’m honored to serve as a vice chair of the House Nursing Caucus and to have a role in the important work of highlighting the critical role that nurses play in every aspect of our health care system—in emergency rooms, classrooms, public health agencies and more.

As a mom and a member of Congress, I know that we need to do more to invest in our children and set them on a path to success. I saw how Community Action Hillsboro, Oregon and Head Start are helping kids here in Washington County. In Congress, I’ll fight to make sure head start and child nutrition programs are fully funded.

Small businesses are an essential part of our economy. Several entrepreneurs and officials from U.S. Small Business Administration, Oregon Tradeswomen, Inc., Hispanic Chamber, and others joined me for a great discussion about my bipartisan legislation to expand opportunities in our region by increasing the number of federal government contracts awarded to small businesses, especially those owned by veterans, minorities, and women.

Sensible criminal justice reform has long been a bipartisan and humanitarian issue. I am disappointed that Attorney General Sessions now wants prosecutors to ignore discretion and seek the longest possible sentences. As our nation faces a crisis with opioid addiction, we should focus on drug treatment, prevention, and evidence-based policies that reduce the prison population while keeping our communities safe.

I'm on my way back to DC, where I will demand an immediate investigation into Trump’s reckless and risky disclosure of classified information to Russia. We cannot afford loose talk in national security discussions. #FollowTheFacts

This is unacceptable. The American Society of Civil Engineers give our country’s infrastructure a D+ rating. It’s time to #InvestInAmerica and fix our roads, bridges, public transportation systems, and public buildings. We need a robust infrastructure package, including ports and railroads, to create jobs and boost the economy.

In communities across NW Oregon, career and technical education classes are engaging students and preparing them for success in and after high school—regardless of what path they take. And today there’s good news. I worked with my colleagues on the Education and the Workforce Committee, and we just approved bipartisan legislation that improves  #CTE programs and increases funding. I hope the entire House votes soon.  http://bonamici.house.gov/press-release/bonamici-applauds-update-career-and-technical-education-programs

Disturbing revelations keep coming out about the Trump Administration’s attempts to shut down the FBI investigation. Democrats have called on House leadership to vote on establishing an independent, outside commission to investigate Trump’s connections to Russia and Russian interference in our election. The Republicans need to put partisanship aside and support an independent investigation. We must get complete and unbiased answers. #FollowtheFacts #ProtectOurDemocracy

The appointment of Robert Mueller to investigate Russian interference in our elections is a step in the right direction. #Mueller needs sufficient resources and independence so the investigation can #FollowTheFacts. The American people are alarmed and deserve answers. I continue my call for an independent commission to fully investigate this serious matter.

The growing retirement security crisis threatens millions of Americans and jeopardizes their ability to retire with dignity. Congress should be supporting states like Oregon that have created innovative programs to help workers save for retirement and carry their savings from job to job. Today I introduced a bill to clarify federal law so states and cities can give more workers the opportunity to save for a secure retirement. #SaveRetirement

The Trump Administration’s attacks on science are alarming and diminish the public’s trust in government. I was proud to join Congressman Don Beyer and my colleagues on Committee on Science, Space, & Technology - Democrats in calling for the President to stop peddling fake news. Trump should appoint a qualified science advisor ASAP! #DefendScience

Crisis Pregnancy Centers masquerade as legitimate health care clinics, but in reality many operate with the sole purpose of counseling women against abortion. Too often these centers lure women in and then push a one-sided, anti-choice agenda that scares women and promotes mistruths and lies. At a time when women’s reproductive rights are under attack, we are demanding truthful information. It’s time to stop crisis pregnancy centers from impersonating real health care clinics.

A budget is a statement of values and priorities. President Trump’s budget is hard on seniors, children, and everyone in between, and it shows that the President is both completely out of touch with families who are working hard to put food on the table and woefully unaware about what kind of support our communities need to grow and thrive.

It’s another busy day on Capitol Hill, but I enjoyed having some time with Gregorio during #DCShadowDay. It’s inspiring to see Gregorio succeeding at Portland Community College. As we discuss foster care and education issues, it's important to have #FosterYouthVoices like Gregorio's.

Oregon parents pay some of the highest child care costs in the country – sometimes as much as college tuition. Watch as I participate in the Democratic Women's Working Group discussion about steps we can take to make high-quality child care more affordable and accessible so families have the opportunity to succeed. Tune in below! #ChildCareNow
The score from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office shows that 23 million will lose their coverage in the next decade under the American Health Care Act. That's unacceptable.

Seniors deserve to retire and age with dignity, but too many seniors are at risk of physical, emotional, and financial abuse. As the co-chair of the Elder Justice Caucus, I’m working to update the Elder Justice Act to help protect the physical, emotional, and financial safety of our older Americans.

President Trump's proposed budget would harm America's #WorkingFamilies to give tax breaks to the wealthy. Today Senator Ron Wyden and I heard from Oregonians about the personal toll that this budget would take on their lives and families. I hope Congress will reject this budget and work together in a bipartisan way to help working families succeed.

My heart grieves for the brave community members who lost their lives after intervening to stop an anti-Muslim assault in Portland. What has our country come to? Please join me in standing with our Muslim neighbors and condemning the hate speech and violence. And let's offer our condolences to the grieving families of the model citizens who courageously stood up for their neighbors and our American values.

Today in Tualatin and Hillsboro I honored those who gave their lives in service to our country. No words can express the depth of our respect and gratitude for these courageous men and women who gave everything to defend and protect what our country stands for - freedom, justice, and opportunity. Their courage and bravery is a profound example of what it means to be an American, and remembering them today – and every day - is important.

The Wapato Lake National Wildlife Refuge and Fernhill Wetlands in NW Oregon preserve water quality, offer recreation opportunities, and provide refuge for fish and wildlife. It's important to protect and maintain these areas and others like them that provide so much potential now and for years to come.

Students in Dayton High School are motivated and inspired.They have the Oregon GEAR UP program to provide support and guidance now in preparation for college later. And they have Innovate Dayton to partner with their innovation class, where they learn skills that will help them be creative, critical thinkers. I'll be fighting the Trump Administration's proposed budget cuts to GEAR UP and the Every Student Succeeds Act grant programs that support well-rounded education.
Thank you Nicholas Kristof for the meaningful words during this difficult time.

Fishing is an important part of the economy in coastal communities and has been for centuries. I’m committed to helping this industry—and the many families who depend on it—thrive. Thank you to the many experts and local leaders who shared their insight and expertise today at the first ever Community Fisheries Tour in Astoria.

Air and water pollution don’t recognize international borders. Withdrawing from the #ParisAgreement will move us closer to irreparable damage to our planet’s health and our nation’s credibility. #ActonClimate #DefendScience

Students in Astoria High School’s engineering technology and marine biology classes get hands-on education to prepare them for success in college or in the workplace. I’ll keep working in Congress to advance bipartisan legislation to strengthen career and technical education like the classes in Astoria. #CTEworks
As our community begins the healing process, please join me at noon today to pause and honor the heroism of Rick Best, Taliesin Myrddin Namkai-Meche, and Micah Fletcher.

Oregonians, including the scientists and conservation advocates I met with at the Lower Columbia Estuary Partnership conference, are deeply concerned about #ClimateChange. When I go back to Washington DC, I’ll keep working toward solutions to this critical challenge because the future of our planet depends on it.

Congratulations to Rachel Harry of Hood River Valley High School, who will be receiving the Excellence in Theatre Education Award at the Tony Awards! Arts education can transform lives, and it's great to see an Oregon teacher inspiring students to follow their dreams.

When students with disabilities transition from high school to higher education, they shouldn’t face hurdles when seeking the support they need. I’m pleased to partner with Rep. Larry Bucshon to introduce commonsense, bipartisan legislation that will streamline the process for receiving accommodations in college.

Oregon is at the forefront of an exciting timber manufacturing technology with enormous potential. Cross-laminated timber and other advanced wood products create more value and jobs from our natural resources and create sustainable, resilient buildings. I look forward to watching the 11-story Framework building rise in NW Portland, and I’ll be a champion for this technology in Congress.

Students can’t concentrate or learn when they are hungry. During the summer months, many families and students struggle to find regular, nutritious meals. I joined Feeding America and some local students who are raising their voices for other kids facing hunger in America. #HungrytoHelp

James Comey’s testimony showed that Trump tried to get him to end the Flynn investigation and to pledge loyalty. And when asked whether there was truth to Trump’s statement that Comey had lost the support of the FBI agents, Comey said “those were lies, plain and simple.” This testimony makes clear that the President has something to hide, and we are dealing with a threat to our democracy – foreign interference with our elections. We need an independent investigation so the American people get all of the answers. #FollowtheFacts #ComeyDay

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) has assisted more than 29 million consumers - many of them seniors - with mortgages, credit cards, and debt collectors. Unfortunately, the House just passed a bill to gut the CFPB, which will take us back to predatory lending practices, abusive payday lenders, and unscrupulous debt collectors. I voted no. It's called the CHOICE Act, but it's the choice for Oregonians and Americans. #WrongChoiceAct

While people across the country were focused on the #Comey hearing, House leadership passed a terrible bill that will gut the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) and weaken consumer protections against unscrupulous lending practices and deceptive debt collectors. Without these protections, our country will be at risk of another financial disaster. #WrongChoiceAct

America’s veterans have made many sacrifices for freedom and democracy. Thank you Honor Flight of Portland Oregon for bringing Oregon’s World War II veterans to Washington, DC to visit the memorials that honor their service!

A year ago 49 innocent people, many who were members of the #LGBTQ community, lost their lives at the Pulse nightclub. Today - with tears in my eyes - I pause to remember them. Tomorrow and in days to come, please join me as I continue to fight for all Americans – no matter who they are or who they love – to have the same rights and dignities, and to find a way to bring the community together to reduce gun violence. #Equality

Education Secretary DeVos is proposing having one company service all federal student loans. This decision threatens consumer protections that help borrowers to work with loan servicing companies to avoid delinquencies and defaults. I strongly urge Secretary DeVos to reconsider this and focus on helping student loan borrowers.

This morning several innocent people, including some of my Congressional colleagues, were attacked as they practiced for the Congressional Baseball Game. I thank the brave Capitol Police Officers and Alexandria Police for their response to this horrific shooting. My thoughts and prayers are with Congressman Steve Scalise, the Capitol Police officers, Congressional aides, and others who were wounded this morning, and I wish them each a full and speedy recovery.   The annual Congressional Baseball Game is a tradition and an opportunity for members of Congress, their staff, and families to come together and raise money for charity. I’m confident in the collective strength of my colleagues as we stand together against this cowardly, criminal act.

Congratulations to the Stoller Middle School team for making it to the National History Day competition with their documentary on Aung San Suu Kyi. These young women have a bright future ahead of them!

Happy #PrideMonth to the whole LGBTQ community and to Portland, where we will be celebrating this weekend! Through strength and continued perseverance, the LGBTQ movement has made tremendous progress. Yet our work continues: we must protect trans people from discrimination and violence, make sure all LGBTQ youth have a home, and end violence and oppression against LGBTQ people internationally. I’m proud to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with you in the fight for #EqualityforAll, this month and every month.

We desperately need comprehensive immigration reform to keep families together but, for now, I am relieved that the Administration has said it will preserve the DACA program. Young people brought to the United States as babies or children know no other country, are contributing members of our communities, and should be able to live here free from fear of deportation.

I enjoyed visiting Portland Community College Rock Creek’s STEAM Lab and watching Zippy the drone fly. This #MakerSpace expands opportunities to design, build, and invent. As a co-founder of the Congressional STEAM Caucus and member of the Maker Caucus, I’ll continue to support policies that promote hands-on learning to develop innovative, creative thinking.
Refugees like Koma fled violence and famine in search of safety and a better life. On #WorldRefugeeDay, the US must reaffirm our leadership in promoting the safety, health, & well-being of refugees.

Please join me on Monday, June 26 at 6pm Pacific time for a telephone town hall meeting. I’ll be providing an update about my work in Congress and taking your questions. Sign up to participate at: bonamici.house.gov/telephone-town-hall.

Thank you Dr. Hales from Oregon State University for testifying at House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology. Dr. Hales explained how federal research grants can drive the development of innovative technology.

The need for paid family and medical leave is urgent! For a thriving workforce and economy, working families need paid family and medical leave to care for their own illnesses, that of a family members, or care for a child. #PaidLeaveNow

The President said the House health care bill is "mean" - so is the bill just released by Senate Republican Leadership. It is just as dangerous for Oregonians and Americans as the House bill, and it's just as mean. Written behind closed doors, the Senate #TrumpCare proposal rolls back Medicaid and puts millions of people, including many vulnerable people, at risk of losing health care coverage. I’m deeply disappointed that Republican leadership continues to push through these harmful proposals - especially without hearings or input from patients or medical providers.

Today the House passed a bill to support career and technical education classes! #CTE engages students and prepares them for success in and after high school. Strengthening #SkillsBasedEd is good for students and for the economy, and I hope the Senate passes this important legislation.

It's the 45th anniversary of Title IX, landmark legislation prohibiting discrimination in education based on sex. Written by Oregon Representative Edith Green, #TitleIX revolutionized women’s inclusion in sports and education. As we celebrate #TitleIXat45, we also recognize that there is still more work to do. We must protect students from campus sexual assault and encourage more women to enter traditionally male-dominated fields.

Kalpana, and many Oregonians, are dealing with cancer in their families. Their focus should be on caring for their loved one – not navigating how to pay medical bills. It’s a disgrace that the Senate might vote this week on a #TrumpCare bill that will put millions of people at risk of losing health care coverage.

UPDATE: Reports are the Senate is postponing the vote on TrumpCare. Thank you to everyone who raised your voice and spoke out. Let’s all get back to the table and talk about how we can improve – not take away – access to affordable health care for all Americans.   Recently I voted against #TrumpCare; the Senate is set to vote on a similar bill this week. Oregonians like Kalpana are rightly worried. #TrumpCare will be a disaster for Oregonians and Americans.

Meeting students like the “The Three Musketeeretts” team members makes me optimistic about the future. Their creative problem solving skills have brought them to DC for the eCYBERMISSION national finals. Oregon is proud of you! #eCYBER17

Forest Grove is a vibrant, growing community, but the old Post Office was a leaky, dilapidated fire hazard. I advocated for the Postal Service to relocate the facility, and I’m thrilled to see that the new Post Office is open for business.
Unfortunately, the House just passed a bill to limit access to justice when devastating medical injuries occur. We should be promoting patient safety, not taking rights away from victims.

The Senate delayed a vote on #TrumpCare, but keep speaking out because it might come back soon. I #StandwithPP and say: NO to defunding Planned Parenthood, NO to repealing the ACA, and NO to TrumpCare.

Need more proof that the Affordable Care Act saves lives? Oregon Health & Science University (OHSU) researchers discovered a significant drop in cardiac arrests in Multnomah County. Here are two reasons why: the expansion of Medicaid and greater access to preventive care. #TrumpCare will cut both.

Oregon should not send voter data to the "Presidents's Commission on Election Integrity." If Trump’s true motivation was to protect the integrity of US elections, he would reinstate the Voting Rights Act to make sure every eligible American voter is able to cast a ballot without barriers or intimidation. I urge the President to put down his phone and stop tweeting, stop claiming that there are millions of illegal voters, and get serious about leading this country.
