Join Senator Ron Wyden and Congresswoman Suzanne Bonamici for a Town Hall meeting in Beaverton!  Town Hall meetings provide an opportunity to discuss issues, answer questions, and gather ideas.  Beaverton Town Hall Meeting Date: Thursday, July 6, 2017 Time: 2:00pm Location: Conestoga Recreation & Aquatic Center, 9985 SW 125th Ave, Beaverton  To stay up to date on future town hall meetings, please subscribe to the Bonamici Bulletin monthly e-newsletter by clicking here: https://bonamici.house.gov/contact-me/newsletter.

This #FourthofJuly, I’m reflecting on the wisdom of our founders in creating three separate and co-equal branches of government, and celebrating the American values of justice, liberty, and respect for all. Wishing your families and friends a safe and peaceful #Independence Day!

As Congress writes a budget, I will fight to protect programs that support veterans, seniors, and families who are struggling to get by. Thank you to the staff at Community Action Team in Columbia County and the community members who shared stories about the importance of maintaining our federal safety net.

Trumpcare would be a disaster for Oregonians and people across the country. Today I joined with Senator Ron Wyden and Senator Jeff Merkley to speak out against this harmful proposal. We should be increasing access to affordable health care for everyone, not threatening millions with higher costs, less coverage, and loss of insurance.

Hearing from my constituents is an important part of my job. Thanks to the more than 500 people in Beaverton who came to the town hall meeting today and shared thoughts and concerns about health care, foreign affairs, national security, protecting our public lands, and much more.

Employers and workers benefit when people are able to get the skills necessary to secure good-paying jobs and provide for their families. I visited two workforce development programs in Washington County that would be eliminated under President Trump’s proposed budget. I will continue to stand up for programs that help seniors, farmworkers, and everyone in our community pursue a brighter future.

Every child should have access to quality, affordable health care. I appreciated the opportunity to meet with Dr. Nason, the current President of the Oregon Pediatric Society, to discuss how Trumpcare and proposed cuts to Medicaid would be devastating for children and families. I will continue to work to protect access to health care so all kids can be healthy.  #KeepKidsCovered

Children should not live in fear that their parents will be gone when they come home from school-- but that is the reality for too many children of immigrants. Thanks to the Lower Columbia Hispanic Council for your work to support and empower the Latino community on the North Coast.

Donald Trump Jr.’s emails are yet another reason why we need an independent investigation. We must find out the extent of Russian meddling in our election and uncover any influence on the Administration. It’s dangerous to our democracy. #FollowTheFacts

Every day the U.S. Coast Guard protects our shores and keeps people safe. It was great to meet with U.S. Coast Guard Sector Columbia River members in Astoria and learn more about their important work. I will continue working in Congress to support their efforts.

Thank you Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) for protecting access to justice for consumers. For years, forced arbitration has required too many Americans to sign away their legal protections against unscrupulous practices of financial institutions. This final rule will protect millions of consumers, and I will stand strong against any efforts to undermine it.

These incredible Afghan students have overcome many obstacles so they can participate in FIRST Global robotics competition, but our country has denied their visas. I urge the State Department to reconsider and allow them to travel to the U.S. to compete with peers from around the globe.

Protecting #NetNeutrality is about keeping the internet open and fair. The Federal Communications Commission and some internet service providers are trying to end many protections for consumers. Net Neutrality preserves the internet as we know it, and I’ll fight in Congress to keep it that way so consumers, innovators, and small businesses have a level playing field.

I’m thrilled that the FIRST Global team from Afghanistan will now be able to attend the robotics competition in person! Earlier this week, Congressman Joe Courtney and I asked the Secretary of State to issue the students visas to attend the competition.
NA

The latest #TrumpCare “plan” from Senate Republican Leadership would allow insurance companies to sell junk policies. Decades ago I helped low-income families with financial counseling at Legal Aid. Many were struggling because of medical debt because they didn't have insurance, or their policy didn't cover them when they needed it. We can’t go back to the days when a visit to the emergency room or an unexpected diagnosis drove families into bankruptcy. #ProtectOurCare

America needs great scientists, computer programmers, and engineers to solve the challenges we face. It was amazing today to talk with a group of young women in Washington, DC  who are exploring the STEM/STEAM fields. I encouraged them all to work hard and think creatively to solve problems. I’m excited to see what these young women accomplish!

Looking for something to watch this weekend? Chasing Coral is a FANTASTIC and compelling documentary about the effect of rising ocean temperatures on delicate coral ecosystems. We need healthy oceans for a healthy planet. Watch on Netflix and tell me what you think in the comments!

#TrumpCare is dangerous and irresponsible, and I'm glad the Senate doesn't have the votes to pass it. But now Senate Republican leadership wants to repeal The Affordable Care Act with nothing to replace it. Repeal means going back to the days when insurance companies could discriminate against women and people with pre-existing conditions, and medical debt drove too many families into bankruptcy. I’m ready and willing to work with my colleagues to improve access to health care and make sure coverage is not just a privilege for the healthy and wealthy. #ProtectOurCare
NA

Financial advisors should be acting in the best interests of their clients, not pushing products that will boost their own fees. I’m disappointed that the Republicans on the House Committee on Education and the Workforce are working to dismantle consumer protections. Congress should be focused on expanding opportunities for Americans to save for a secure retirement, not undermining them. #SaveMySavings

The #TrumpCare efforts in the Senate keep changing. This is where their plan stands right now with full repeal:  1.      Average premiums would DOUBLE in the next 10 years, and  2.      By 2026, leave 32 million more people would be uninsured – that’s 21% of population uninsured.  Repealing the Affordable Care Act is extreme and reckless and must be stopped. It’s time for Republicans to allow an open, bipartisan process.
Senator John McCain is a fighter, and I wish him the best in his battle against cancer.

Improving access to health care is about improving the lives of people like 13-year-old Ella. I met Ella a few years ago when she came to the Capitol to advocate for more funding for Cystic Fibrosis research. Now Ella and her family are worried that #TrumpCare could financially devastate their family if their insurance company cuts benefits or reinstates lifetime coverage caps.
The timber industry is an important part of Oregon's history and our future. It was exciting to tour the newly reopened Hampton Lumber Mill in Banks.

Emergency responders play an essential role in our communities. I appreciate Banks Fire District 13’s commitment to educating young people and helping them access higher education and find meaningful careers. Thanks for sharing your work with me!

I’m disappointed that the Senate voted to begin debate on repealing the Affordable Care Act. Dismantling the ACA is reckless, and taking away coverage from tens of millions of Americans is cruel. And this whole process has been done in secret behind closed doors, without public hearings. Instead of jamming through a repeal of the Affordable Care Act, we should be working together to bring down health care costs and expand coverage. #ProtectOurCare

Today the House rolled back important consumer protections by blocking the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)’s rule about arbitration. This rule will protect consumers by allowing them access to justice in court and to participate in class-action lawsuits against unscrupulous financial institutions. We must reject #RipoffClause! #ConsumersFirst

I am incredibly proud to have met so many Oregonians, including committed transgender servicemembers, who have served our nation honorably. The President’s decision to deny them the opportunity to serve goes against the values that our military fights to protect. Turning our backs on these transgender individuals is discriminatory and unacceptable.   We overturned Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell more than five years ago, and military experts have reported no negative effects. In fact, forcing troops to hide who they are and denying them health care services could diminish the effectiveness of our military. I urge the Defense Department to continue to accept the transgender servicemembers and their families who are faithfully serving us. #ProtectTransTroops

It’s ridiculous. The House is actually voting on giving $1.6 billion to build President Trump’s #borderwall. Experts agree that a border wall won’t make us safer, and it's a waste of money. We have many valid infrastructure needs in our country that we should be funding. And whatever happened to President Trump's promise that Mexico would pay for the wall?! I'll be voting no.

#TrumpCare failed - in part because of everyone who called, wrote, and spoke out against this proposal. Abandoning the regular legislative process, writing the bill behind closed doors, and trying to pass a bill as important as this without hearings is not the way to make policy. I stand ready and willing to work together to update the Affordable Care Act, improve access to health care, and reduce costs. #ProtectOurCare

Today I was happy to support bipartisan legislation to improve care for our veterans. Extending the Choice program and investing in the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs workforce will help us deliver the results our veterans need and deserve.

Immigrants who arrived in the US as children have only known one country. They live here, go to school here, and work here. I’m supporting the #AmericanHopeAct to protect #Dreamers and put them on a path to legal status and earning citizenship.

Today is the 52nd anniversary of #Medicare and #Medicaid. And this is my mom and me. In a few weeks, we’ll be celebrating Mom’s 89th birthday. She’s been a piano teacher, book lover, poet, painter, world traveler, and small business owner. She’s a fighter; she’s survived breast cancer and lung cancer, and she’s been through surgery and chemo. Now Mom has Alzheimer’s, which is a daily struggle. But fortunately, she has been able to rely on Medicare, and so did my stepfather when he was diagnosed with cancer, right up until he passed away last year. Without Medicare, their medical needs would have brought significant stress to them and to the family. When some of my colleagues talk about cutting Medicare or Medicaid, I think about how cuts could send families into anxiety and financial ruin. So while Mom is fighting disease, I’ll be fighting to protect earned benefits like Medicare, Medicaid, and Social Security.
This hot weather is unpleasant—and dangerous. If you live in Washington County and don’t have air-conditioning at home, please check out this list of cooling centers, and share with others.

Betsy DeVos wanted to consolidate all federal student loan servicing with one company. That's a bad idea, and I’m relieved the U.S. Department of Education backed away from this short-sighted plan. I'll continue to closely track the Department’s actions to make sure they strengthen – not weaken - consumer protections for student loan borrowers and make it easier for them to manage their loans.

Income-driven repayment plans help struggling student loan borrowers make affordable payments. My bipartisan #SIMPLEAct helps to prevent default by improving access to income-driven payment plans and streamlining the paperwork. We must do more to reduce the burden of student debt that is holding back so many people in this country.

Too often consumers are at an unfair advantage when dealing with giant financial institutions. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) creates a fair playing field and amplifies the voice of consumers. In Congress, I’ll continue to put #ConsumersFirst and #DefendCFPB.

Getting ready for KATU News. Tune in for an update about what I’m working on, including making higher education more affordable, calling for a #RussiaInvestigation, stopping #Trumpcare, and addressing #ClimateChange.

It was an honor to receive the Ecological Society of America Regional Policy Award tonight and speak with ecologists and scientists, including former NOAA Administrator Dr. Jane Lubchenco. I’ll keep fighting for policy decisions to be based on science and working to protect the federal investment in science and research. #ESA2017

Coastal business owners shared their priorities and concerns with me today in Cannon Beach. Thanks to the Cannon Beach Chamber of Commerce for hosting a great discussion about economic growth, the affordable housing crisis, health care, and immigration reform.

In the era of climate change, we must invest more - not less - in science and research. I appreciate NOAA Fisheries Service biologists, who are conducting important research on the Columbia River estuary and the health of our fisheries and oceans.

We need strong and consistent foreign policy regarding North Korea. The President’s belligerent remarks exacerbated tensions, and now Secretary of State Tillerson and Defense Secretary Mattis are trying to repair the damage. This Administration needs to have a cohesive strategy that optimizes the possibility of nonviolent resolution and minimizes the chance of war, and they need to communicate that strategy to the American people. Earlier this week I talked with KATU News about North Korea and other news. See the interview here:

Students lose valuable progress when they are out of school; sometimes called the “summer slide.” It was great to see Beaverton Education Foundation’s Camp Achieve at Mckay Elementary School. Kids are learning new critical skills in literacy and math through hands-on learning and the integration of arts and crafts.

My offices in Beaverton and Washington, D.C. are seeking interns for the autumn term. Interns gain valuable experience conducting legislative research and supporting staff with constituent communication while learning about the operations of a congressional office. Our office is committed to assigning our interns to policy areas that interest them. High school seniors, college students, and recent graduates are encouraged to apply. Applications for the autumn 2017 internship are accepted on a rolling basis with preference given to those who apply by September 29th. To apply, please visit: https://bonamici.house.gov/services/internships
I strongly condemn the white supremacist rally in Virginia and the violence that has erupted. Free speech embodies what we stand for as Americans; violence and hatred do not.

Waiting two days to call racism evil isn’t just a failure in presidential leadership; it’s shameful. Sadly, I’m not surprised by the President’s lack of action. President Trump has advisors who are racist and hateful. I’ve called for the resignation of Steve Bannon, who has a long history of supporting white supremacists, since the day he was appointed. Now it’s time for him to be fired. The President’s delayed and wholly inadequate response to the domestic terrorism in Charlottesville is a new low, and we must never accept this as normal.

The President’s remarks suggesting support for the neo-Nazi rally in Charlottesville are abhorrent. He blamed ‘both sides,’ but there is only one side—the side of those standing against hate, racism, and anti-Semitism. Click here for my full statement.

A new report from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) shows that 40% of undergraduate students leave school with more than $20,000 in debt. Educational debt is undermining borrowers’ financial stability and limiting their choices. We must do more to address the student debt crisis. #AimHigher

I’ve opposed having Steve Bannon and his bigoted beliefs in the White House since before Trump took office. Today Bannon is out, but he never should have been there in the first place. I’ll continue to fight for fairness and equality, and to hold this Administration accountable.

Who better to answer all your #Eclipse2017 questions than the brilliant scientists at NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration? Check out NASA’s eclipse site for safety tips--yes, you need eclipse glasses--science, activities, live video, and more.

In Afghanistan and around the world, the United States must have a clear and thoughtful foreign policy that reflects the complexities of the evolving threats to our nation and our allies. Ordering American soldiers to engage in a war overseas is the most difficult and serious decision our government can make. Although we must not turn our backs on the Afghan people or withdraw all U.S. presence before the country is on a successful path to stability, I have significant concerns about sending what appears to be thousands of additional troops into harm's way without a clearly articulated strategy and end goal. I encourage my colleagues to fulfill our Constitutional duties by thoroughly engaging with the Administration and scrutinizing President Trump's proposal. We must hold him accountable for keeping our country safe and responsibly ending this war.
It’s inspiring to talk with young people who want to serve their communities through leadership. Thank you to the Bus Project Politicorps Fellows for visiting my office today, and good luck!

Far too many students experience sexual assault at their colleges and universities. When Secretary DeVos’s staff made inappropriate comments earlier this summer that diminished the seriousness of campus sexual assault, many colleagues and I raised concerns. I’ll continue holding this Administration accountable for protecting the safety and privacy of all students, including survivors of sexual assault.

Today in Vernonia I met with city leaders and heard their plans for a new senior center and food bank. Community Development Block Grant funds are helping this small community take care of seniors, but President Trump proposed eliminating this fund. In Congress, I’ll keep fighting for programs like this that help seniors, especially in rural areas.

Congratulations to the students graduating from the PIVOT Job Corps program. None of us can know where our path in life will take us, but with your knowledge and skills, you’ll be prepared for the opportunities that come your way. Best of luck to you!

Hoping for the best for the people of Texas, please stay safe. I’m ready to work with House leaders to strengthen National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) and U.S. National Weather Service (NWS) to better prepare communities for severe weather events. #Harvey

Students are returning to Linfield College and colleges and universities across the country this week. Addressing the student debt crisis and increasing access to higher education continue to be among my top priorities. Wishing all new and returning students a productive and safe fall semester!

Women’s Equality Day marks the 97th anniversary of the 19th Amendment, which recognized that American women have a right to vote. We still have a lot of work to do to achieve full equality for women, but it gives me hope to remember the perseverance and courage of the many women who got us this far: suffragists, civil rights leaders, feminists, LGBTQ women, those who ran for office, and those who cast ballots.

Oregon is known for our incredible agricultural products, including dairy. It was exciting to visit the new Organic Valley Creamery in McMinnville and one of its member farms in Dayton. In Congress, I’m proud to advocate for organic farming.
NA

Innovative businesses like Ruby Receptionists are thriving in Oregon-- and supporting and retaining talented employees with flexible, family-friendly workplace policies. Thanks to the employees who shared your thoughts with Congressman Eric Swalwell and me an employee forum today. #FutureForum
NA

One of my priorities in Congress is addressing the college affordability and student debt crisis. Congressman Eric Swalwell and I appreciated hearing from student leaders from Portland State University, Linfield College, Portland Community College, Pacific University, and Western Oregon University with their ideas about how to address this and many other issues, including climate change and civil rights.

Wieden+Kennedy is a pillar of Portland's creative economy. I enjoyed visiting with Congressman Eric Swalwell and learning about their efforts to create a more inclusive and equitable workplace that embraces younger workers.

Protecting #VotingRights and increasing voter participation are essential to our democracy. Thanks to the many advocates working on #CivicEngagement in Oregon, including Latino Network, Portland African American Leadership Forum (PAALF), Family Forward Oregon, League of Women Voters of Portland, and Basic Rights Oregon. I'll keep fighting to protect voting rights and expand voter access in Washington DC. #FutureForum

Diversity is one of Washington County's strengths. The Washington County Cooperative Library Services (WCCLS) is supporting all young children, including immigrants and refugees, by giving them a strong start in reading with their Bridging Cultures - Growing Early Readers program.

Too many seniors struggle with hunger, including thousands in Oregon. I was glad to help deliver meals to homebound seniors today and offer them companionship and a good meal. In Congress, I'll fight the President's starvation budget, which would cut the programs that fund Meals on Wheels People and anti-hunger programs.

Caring for our neighbors is one of the core tenets of many faith traditions. I appreciate the work of the Interfaith Movement for Immigrant Justice to bring to life our shared values of justice and dignity for all, including our immigrant and refugee neighbors.

People concerned about gun violence have sent me hundreds of postcards opposing attempts to undermine commonsense gun safety laws. I share the concerns of Moms Demand Action - OR and the many constituents who’ve written me about gun violence prevention. Your voices make a difference.

Electric vehicles can help reduce our dependence on fossil fuels and polluting emissions. I had fun learning more about EVs at Forth in Portland today. I'll continue to advocate for clean transportation options.

Cut-My-Timber Inc. is one of the Oregon companies leading the way in advanced manufacturing of cross-laminated timber. These timber products create more jobs and value from our natural resources, and create more sustainable buildings. I’m proud to advocate for cross-laminated timber in Congress with the #TimberInnovation Act.

Labor Day is a time to celebrate American workers and the accomplishments of the labor movement: better wages, family and medical leave, workplace safety protections, and much more. Thank you to Portland Firefighters Association, IAFF Local 43 and Tualatin Valley Firefighters Union - IAFF Local 1660 in Beaverton for working this weekend to keep our communities safe. Happy Labor Day to everyone, especially our union brothers and sisters.

I’ve met many ‘Dreamers,’ hard-working young adults whose parents brought them to the United States as children, searching for a better life and working toward the American dream. The Trump Administration’s decision to end the DACA program sends a message to the rest of the world that our country has lost its humanitarian spirit and inclusive values. I stand ready, willing, and able to work with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to pass much-needed comprehensive immigration reform legislation that will allow these young people to continue living their lives in the only country they’ve ever known. #DefendDACA

The wildfires raging across Oregon are dangerous and devastating. I’m joining with all my Oregon colleagues in the US House of Representatives to fight for emergency wildfire funding this week. Please stay safe, follow evacuation orders if you are near a fire, and avoid unhealthy air quality levels.
Tune in as a I join my fellow House Democrats calling for Congress to #ProtectDREAMers.

All cases of campus sexual harassment and assault must be taken seriously and survivors must be treated with compassion. I have repeatedly called on Secretary DeVos to stand up for sexual assault survivors, and it is unacceptable that she and the U.S. Department of Education now appear to be slowing efforts to address systemic campus-based sexual assault. #DefendTitleIX

The effects of climate change threaten public health, local economies, and the planet, but the Trump Administration is trying to defund important scientific research on climate change. This week the House will consider my amendment to restore funding for National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)'s coastal research. I will keep fighting to protect scientific research. #DefendScience

This fall I will be hosting six #townhall meetings around Northwest Oregon. Town hall meetings provide an opportunity to discuss issues facing the residents of the diverse district I am honored to represent. Several of my staff members will be available to assist anyone who has questions about or problems with federal agencies. Visit bonamici.house.gov/2017TownHallMeetings for dates and locations.

Today I helped pack USO care packages for National Guard members engaged in disaster relief in Texas and Florida. It was just a few moments of my time, but it's a way to thank the servicemembers who keep us safe at home in abroad. #BeTheForce

As co-founder and co-chair of the bipartisan STEAM Caucus, I know the transformative power of arts education. By integrating arts and design into STEM fields, students learn valuable critical thinking skills. #BecauseOfArtsEd students today are preparing for the future and the innovation economy. Join me in celebrating #ArtsEdWeek!

The high cost of child care in Oregon and across the country means that too many low-income families rely on a ‘patchwork' of care for their kids. I’m proud to support the Child Care for Working Families Act, a comprehensive plan to help low-income families access good quality child care and create a better future for their children. #ABetterDeal #ChildCare4all
I stand with #DREAMers & call on Speaker Paul Ryan to bring #DREAMAct up for vote. #ProtectDREAMers

Investing in our children’s futures through robust early learning programs is one of the best investments we can make. It’s important to sustain the positive effects of preschool by building meaningful connections between early learning and early grades. I appreciate the leadership of Children’s Institute and Earl Boyles Elementary in bridging early childhood education and elementary school, and I’ll continue to champion these issues in Congress.

Thanks to everyone who joined my town hall meetings in North Plains and Tualatin today. We discussed many important issues, including health care, net neutrality, wildfire prevention, and more. I am holding four more town hall meetings this fall. Please join me!

Nursery and greenhouse products are important agricultural products in Oregon. I enjoyed touring a Hillsboro nursery and talking with the nursery owner and employees about their priorities, including comprehensive immigration reform.

I appreciate everyone who came to my town hall meeting in Yamhill and shared your perspective on the economy, health care, immigration, and many other topics. Your thoughts and input make a difference and guide my work in Washington D.C.

Estuaries shelter juvenile salmon and migrating birds, absorb floodwaters, and offer peaceful places for recreation. As co-chair of the Estuaries Caucus, I’m leading my colleagues to support protections for these important natural areas and invest in research and restoration efforts. Happy National #EstuaryWeek!

Please join me in celebrating #HispanicHeritageMonth and the many contributions Latinos make in our communities. At a time when divisive rhetoric and harmful policies target Latinos, it’s more important than ever to say: we value you and we stand with you.

Health care legislation should help Oregonians and Americans, not hurt them. The Graham-Cassidy proposal fails that test, and would result in Oregon losing a bigger share of funding than any other state. I urge my colleagues in the Senate to reject this bill, which would leave millions of people without insurance and raise costs. We should be working together to expand access to affordable health care, not voting again and again on proposals that Oregonians and Americans reject.

Manufacturing is a vital part of the Oregon economy, and provides our communities with living-wage jobs, innovative technology, and high-quality products. I enjoyed seeing Cascades Tissue’s new high-tech paper packaging facility in Scappoose today, and learning about their expansion plans.

At my town hall meeting tonight in Columbia City, constituents shared their views about protecting the Affordable Care Act, supporting veterans, and addressing hunger in our communities. In October I’ll hold two more town hall meetings in Cannon Beach and Portland. Please join me at one of those meetings, and in the meantime please contact my office to share your perspective, or if we can help you with a federal agency.

Access to quality, affordable housing gives members of our community the opportunity to thrive and provide for their families. It was great to visit with residents of Bienestar’s apartments and meet with leadership about their work to make housing accessible to low-income and farmworker families.

Isidro is a long-time employee of Washington County and a U.S. citizen. Earlier this week, plainclothes ICE agents who refused to show identification stopped and tried to detain him and his wife. That’s inexcusable. The actions of the Immigration And Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents do not make our communities safer, and I’m calling for a full investigation.

Today I was thrilled to celebrate the groundbreaking for Cornelius Place, a wonderful project that includes a new library and affordable housing for seniors. I highlighted the federal contribution through Low Income Housing Tax Credits, Community Development Block Grants, and a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities. Congratulations to Cornelius and Washington County!

The #GrahamCassidy version of #Trumpcare could make being a woman a "pre-existing condition" in some states - we won't stand for this! Senate Republican leadership is again trying to push it through this week. Women deserve better. We should be improving health care for Oregonians, not taking it away.

Today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay! Voting is an essential part of our democracy, and in Oregon vote-by-mail and motor-voter registration increase access and participation. If you aren’t registered, I encourage you to visit the Secretary of State’s website and register today.  https://secure.sos.state.or.us/orestar/vr/register.do

Public funding should support public education, not private school vouchers. I joined AFT - American Federation of Teachers, NEA Today, Journey 4 Justice, and civil rights groups in calling on the Trump Administration to stand up for the 50+ million students who attend public schools. We need to deliver on the promise of  equity in education. #WeChoose #PublicEd

Supporting Head Start is a good investment for our children, our families, and our future. In Oregon, Head Start provides about 12,000 children with quality early childhood education and helps  families access health insurance, housing assistance, and job training. In Congress I will continue to fight against budget cuts that threaten this vital program. #HeadStartStrong

Millions of US citizens in Puerto Rico and the US Virgin Islands are still waiting for food, water, and fuel aid. I’ve called on Congress and the President to act quickly to get relief to the islands. The devastation is extensive and aid is needed immediately.

I was thrilled to meet Baby Fatimah today, who is thriving after receiving heart surgery at OHSU. Fatimah and her family were kept out of the US by the Administration's travel ban, but finally made it here in time for Fatimah to receive the health care she needed. Best wishes to this sweet child and her family!
I am filled with grief about the horrific mass shooting in #LasVegas. Our hearts go out to the families and friends of all the victims.

This afternoon, the House of Representatives held a moment of silence. That’s not enough. It wasn’t enough for the Sandy Hook victims and their families, it wasn’t enough for the victims of Umpqua Community College, the Pulse nightclub, and so many more. And offering thoughts and prayers isn’t enough. There are steps we can take to keep our communities safer from gun violence. Congress should take action to require background checks for all firearm purchases, get military-style assault weapons off the streets, study the effects of gun violence in our society, and keep weapons away from abusers and stalkers. We owe it to our children, families, and neighbors.

Another day, another bill restricting abortions. Instead of standing between women and their health care providers, we should be focused on preventing unintended pregnancies and expanding access to comprehensive reproductive care. #Stopthebans

Over the weekend, Congressional Republican Leadership allowed funding to lapse for two programs important to Northwest Oregon. The Children’s Health Insurance Program (also called CHIP) and the Community Health Center Program are critical to the health of children and families in our community. We need Congressional action now to fund these programs! #KeepKidsCovered
I highly recommend reading this thought-provoking piece from Oregonian Nicholas Kristof about his recent visit to North Korea.
Thank you Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) for taking action to stop the cycle of debt created by predatory payday lenders. #EndDebtTraps
It’s not surprising to learn that most Americans agree - consumers should not have to give up their rights to access justice through the courts when they are cheated.

The Trump Administration has decided that virtually anyone – employers, health insurance companies, or schools – can deny a woman access to coverage for birth control. This is unsafe and wrong! Women need access to contraception to control our health and our economic futures. #HandsOffMyBirthControl

Manufacturing provides our communities with living-wage jobs, innovative technology, and high-quality products. Students benefit when they see the many opportunities in manufacturing and when they have access to career and technical education and STEAM education. Thanks to Vernier Software & Technology for introducing students to manufacturing! #ManufacturingDay

Children thrive when they have access to a high-quality, well-rounded education. I was thrilled to help welcome students and the community to Beaverton’s beautiful rebuilt Vose Elementary School. Best wishes for many great school years in this new building!

The Trump Administration’s announcement to roll back the Clean Power Plan is wrong. Power plants are the single largest source of greenhouse gasses in the US, and the Clean Power Plan granted states flexibility to decide how to reduce emissions and meet meaningful targets. Oregon’s leadership in phasing out coal was a great example of all parties working together. For the health of our planet, we need to move toward a clean energy economy, not away from it. #ActonClimate

McMinnville School District has a lot to be proud of, and I’m glad Secretary DeVos was able to see the power of public education in Oregon. When the Secretary returns to Washington, DC, I hope she will reconsider her proposals to privatize public education, cut education funding, and roll back civil rights protections for students. We must work together to implement the bipartisan Every Student Succeeds Act, strengthen public education, and provide equal access and opportunity for all students.

The American people overwhelmingly told Congress to reject #TrumpCare. Determined to get his way, President Trump took executive action to destabilize health care markets, which could lead to inadequate coverage and even higher costs for many Americans. Oregonians deserve access to affordable, quality health care. Let’s work together to improve, not take away, health care coverage.

President Trump should not decertify the international agreement preventing Iran from developing a nuclear weapon. In modern history, even when the party in control changes, Americans have kept their word on international agreements. I’m particularly concerned that abandoning the agreement with Iran sends a message to our adversaries and allies that the United States does not uphold its commitments.   Decertifying the Iran agreement could have rippling repercussions across the globe and could impede diplomatic and other efforts to keep our country safe. President Trump has already done enough damage to the American reputation abroad; I urge him to recertify the Iran agreement and avoid causing any more harm.

Access to affordable health care is important to Oregonians and Americans. President Trump and his allies in Congress won't stop trying to undermine the Affordable Care Act, and the decision today to end assistance to working families is cruel and harmful. I urge the President to stop jeopardizing access to health care and instead work with both parties in Congress to improve our nation’s health care system.
Congress can and must pass common sense gun violence prevention legislation to #KeepAmericansSafe. #HonorwithAction

Today National Endowment for the Arts Chair Jane Chu and I discussed the importance of the arts to well-rounded education. Thank you to Oregon Art Education Association for everything you do to inspire our students and encourage their creativity.

It was great to sit down with Guadalupe Guerrero, the new Portland Public Schools Superintendent. As a leader of the House Education Committee, I look forward to working with Superintendent Guerrero to strengthen public education and provide opportunities for all students to succeed.
Welcome to Portland Chrome Industries! Cycling is a big part of Oregon and it’s exciting to have your headquarters in Portland.

Thank you to everyone who attended my town hall meeting in NW Portland tonight. I appreciated hearing from the community about climate change, preventing gun violence, standing up to the Trump Administration, and more.

Children who get a strong start in reading benefit throughout their lives, but children in rural areas face extra hurdles in accessing books and reading programs. Early federal funding has helped the Libraries ROCC program in Clatsop County expand library access for hundreds of children in rural communities.

The #OpioidCrisis has devastated too many families in Oregon and across the nation. Today in Seaside I met with health care providers, addiction treatment specialists, law enforcement, and parents who have lost children to this crisis. Local, state, and federal officials must cooperate to address this crisis, and maintaining access to affordable health care is key. Taking away health care, increasing the cost by ending premium assistance, or reducing coverage for substance abuse would exacerbate the opioid crisis and result in more lives lost. #ProtectOurCare

At my sixth town hall meeting this fall, Clatsop County residents asked questions about access to health care, climate change, the opioid crisis, tax reform, emergency preparedness, national security, and more. Hearing from constituents informs my work in Washington D.C.. Thank you to everyone who joined the discussion.

I was thrilled to stand with Columbia County leaders to celebrate the new   communications equipment purchased with grant funds from the US Department of Homeland Security. The new "pod runners" can be easily moved to remote locations and will be used during floods or other natural disasters. Thank you to all of our first responders and emergency managers who help make sure that communities are prepared and resilient.

Assessments can be valuable tools when they inform student learning. It was inspiring to see Oregon Education Association and St Helens School District partnering to support educators and implement assessment practices that engage students and make learning relevant.

It was truly an honor to receive AARP’s Congressional Award today. I share the priorities of AARP and its members, and I remain committed to making sure that older Americans have the support and services they need to live healthy, fulfilling, independent lives.

Oregon leads the country in supporting families through workplace policies. I appreciate the employers who go above and beyond and the Center for Parental Leave Leadership and Family Forward Action for shining a light on great employers with the #WhenWorkWorks awards. We still have more to do to make sure all families have the flexibility and economic stability they need to thrive.

Thank you to Pacific University College of Education - Woodburn for inviting me to learn more about your work to educate bilingual and culturally diverse teachers. And, it was great to speak with leaders Oregon Association of Colleges for Teacher Education   who are preparing the next generation of teachers to inspire our students.

Investing in scientific research strengthens our economy and our global leadership. I support the seventeen federally-funded national labs because their work helps us better understand our world and solve new challenges. Thank you to the scientists at National Energy Technology Laboratory in Oregon for inviting me to learn more about your research.

The EPA is censoring scientists, and that’s unacceptable! U.S. Environmental Protection Agency scientists were scheduled to speak about climate change at a conference, and the EPA abruptly said no. EPA Administrator Pruitt needs to come to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology and explain why he is preventing scientists from discussing their research about how climate change impacts public health, local economies, and the planet.

Are you a high school student who can write the next WICKED The Musical or Hamilton: An American Musical? The National Endowment for the Arts’s Musical Theater Songwriting Challenge is accepting entries until January 5. I encourage students to use their creativity and tell a story through music.

Women in the military serve our country with the same courage, dedication, and valor as their male counterparts, yet too often they are made to feel invisible. I'm proud to join Senator Jeff Merkley in bringing the Oregon Department of Veterans' Affairs’ beautiful photo exhibit, I am Not Invisible, to Congress. Our country is stronger because women serve in our armed forces, and I am grateful to the thousands of women servicemembers who protect our national security every day.

Tactics used by some plainclothes ICE officers in Oregon are very concerning. I’m calling on House Judiciary Committee and House Oversight Committee to hold hearings on the agency’s policies and procedures.    https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-blumenauer-schrader-call-hearings-investigate-oregon-ice-incidents
Nearly two months ago the President announced he was ending the DACA program unless Congress took action. We must work together and pass the #DREAMAct immediately!

Too many people in NW Oregon and across the country don’t have the skills they need for the jobs that are available. Today I introduced a bipartisan bill, the PARTNERS Act, with Congressman Drew Ferguson to help close the skills gap. This bill will use existing funds to support more apprenticeships and work-based training programs, especially in small and mid-sized businesses. It’s good for workers, businesses, and the economy.

ICE issued a contradictory and insufficient response to the serious concerns I raised with Rep. Blumenauer about their aggressive actions in Oregon. I will continue to press for a hearing on ICE’s policies and practices until we get answers.

School-based health centers help students get the care they need, and make life easier for working families. The clinic at Century High School is run by Virginia Garcia Memorial Foundation and Health Center and relies in part on federal funding to provide quality care to students. Unfortunately that funding has been in limbo for almost a month. I call on my colleagues in Congress to restore funding for CHIP and Community Health Centers in a bipartisan bill without delay.

Higher education is a great investment, and I applaud these #veterans for pursuing an education with their GI Bill benefits. Portland Community College Rock Creek does an excellent job supporting students who are veterans. As a leader on the Education and the Workforce Committee in Congress, I’ll continue working to make sure veterans are supported and treated fairly by all higher education institutions.
Today is National Prescription Drug Take Back day, from 10 am to 2 pm. One important part of addressing the opioid crisis is getting rid of unused drugs. Find a place to dispose of them here.

People from all walks of life tell me heart-wrenching stories about how the #OpioidCrisis is taking lives and inflicting pain on Oregon families. Everyone agrees that we must do more. Although I welcome the President’s focus on the opioid crisis, I hope his Administration backs up his promises with action—and significant resources. Oregon families, and families across the country, cannot afford to wait.

The serious charges brought against Trump’s former campaign chairman regarding his past activities demonstrates that no one is above the law. As congressional inquiries and Special Counsel Mueller’s investigation into Russian influence continue, we may learn of more wrongdoing-- or not. Whatever the outcome, I urge everyone to follow the news carefully, look for reliable sources, and respect the checks and balances that are such a critical part of our government.

PAE Engineering is an industry leader on family-friendly policies and implementing #paidfamilyleave. We still have more to do to make sure all families have the flexibility and economic stability they need to thrive, but employers that go above and beyond are making a difference.

As the only woman in Oregon’s congressional delegation, I’ve worked hard to advocate for gender equity in the workplace. PDX Women in Tech is doing great work at the local level, and I enjoyed hearing from their members about a broad range of topics, including immigration, equal pay, supporting veterans, and making sure all students have access to quality #STEAM education.

Climate change should not be a partisan issue. My colleagues on the bipartisan Climate Solutions Caucus know that we must work together to #ActonClimate, and we can grow our economy while we protect the planet. Every day, twenty veterans in the U.S. die by suicide. Even one suicide is too many. At the Portland VA, Senator Wyden, Representative Blumenauer, and I spoke with veterans and suicide prevention staff about how we can address this crisis. For any veteran who needs help, the #VeteransCrisisLine is available at VeteransCrisisLine.net or 1-800-273-8255.

Thank you to the Oregon School Boards Association for the great conference and for all you do to strengthen public education. I’ll be fighting Secretary DeVos’s attempts to privatize public schools, and I’ll keep working to fulfill the federal role of equity for all students. And thanks to all of the school board members from across Oregon for everything you do too.

Today - and every day - we recognize our veterans for their many contributions to our country and our communities. Veterans deserve our support, respect, and appreciation. And it’s important to remember the the tens of thousands of women veterans who have served but too often feel left out of the recognition. To all our veterans: thank you.

Our workplace policies have not kept up with our changing workforce. In addition to higher wages, paid sick days, and family leave, workers need flexible and predictable scheduling. As the holiday shopping season approaches, we need to pass the #SchedulesThatWork Act to give working families stability and predictability in their jobs.

Oregonians saving for retirement rely on information from financial advisors and deserve to know that the advice they get is in their best interest. Today I asked Labor Secretary Alexander Acosta to #ProtectWorkers and oppose efforts to roll back the Conflict of Interest rule.

We need a tax code that leads to better jobs, better wages, and a better future for America and for our children and grandchildren. The #GOPTaxPlan fails the test. Watch my remarks about this disastrous, partisan proposal.

We need a tax code that leads to better jobs, better wages, and a better future for America. The #GOPTaxPlan we voted on today fails that test. Thank you to all the Oregonians who sent messages of opposition to the plan – I heard you!

Oregon continues to lead the way in making sure all transgender people can be themselves, at home, at work, and at school. I stand with Oregon's trans students, Basic Rights Oregon, and ACLU of Oregon as they defend Oregon’s Department of Education guidelines for schools on how to create a safe and affirming learning environment for transgender students. This #TransWeek, let's recommit to the work that remains to be done.

Today I heard from workers, apprentices, and community experts about how to get more people into good-paying jobs and help businesses find skilled workers. My bipartisan PARTNERS Act will help by using existing funds for small and medium businesses to develop work-based learning programs, especially in rapidly growing sectors like health care and technology. Increasing the number of paid, on-the-job training programs can get more people back to work. #ApprenticeshipWeek

Have you looked at health insurance options on www.HealthCare.Oregon.Gov yet? You have until December 15 to enroll. You may find a plan that works better for you and your family, or one that costs less.

On this #Transgender Day of Remembrance, we mourn the transgender people, most of whom were trans women of color, who were murdered this year. I stand with the trans community and remain committed to working with my colleagues to make sure our laws protect #transgender people from violence and discrimination. #TDOR

Cybersecurity is critically important, which means we need trained, skilled workers who can protect our data and our systems from attack. I appreciate the leadership of Governor Kate Brown, Technology Association of Oregon, and Oregon Tech to strengthen Oregon’s cybersecurity efforts and educate the next generation of cybersecurity experts.

Protecting #NetNeutrality is about keeping the internet open and fair for everyone and having a level playing field for consumers, innovators, and small businesses. I’m disappointed that the Federal Communications Commission is starting the process to end net neutrality.

The #OpioidCrisis is affecting communities and families across our country. I hosted a very useful discussion in McMinnville about how we can work together with health care providers and recovery specialists to address addiction.

At the Newberg City Club today, I spoke with constituents about health care, the partisan tax reform plan, gun violence prevention, the importance of the arts and education, and more. Your input informs my work in Washington DC. Thank you!

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) is an important agency that levels the playing field for consumers against some of the worst abuses in financial services. The CFPB has protected Americans from predatory payday lending, unscrupulous financial firms, and for-profit schools that mislead students.   The CFPB deserves a leader who shares its mission, and American consumers, borrowers, and homeowners deserve to have someone standing up for them.

Cross-laminated timber is an innovative building material that provides more value and more jobs from our natural resources in Oregon. It was exciting to visit the future headquarters of First Tech Fed being built with #CLT.
The tax bill that passed the House was bad policy; so is the Senate bill. We need tax reform that helps, not hurts, working families and people struggling to get ahead.

Empowering women and their health care providers to discuss pregnancy intention improves health outcomes for mothers and babies, and reduces unintended pregnancies. I had a great discussion with Oregon Foundation for Reproductive Health and reproductive health leaders about my #EQUIPAct, which will create national pilot programs to replicate Oregon’s success with initiatives like #OneKeyQuestion.

I agree that “elected officials must take serious their legal obligation to keep courthouses accessible.” My Protecting Sensitive Locations bill is modeled after current DHS guidance that acknowledges the importance of ICE staying out of places like schools, hospitals, and places of worship because their presence can prevent people from engaging in the crucial functions of our society. Our bill adds courthouses to that list. Aggressive ICE enforcement is chilling our neighbors’ ability to access justice and making our communities less safe.

STEAM education can help students prepare for the future and for 21st Century jobs. Integrating arts and design into Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math helps students learn by thinking creatively and solving problems. More Oregon schools are implementing #STEAM to engage students and educate the next generation of innovative thinkers.
The President tweeting insulting anti-Muslim videos was offensive, dangerous, and just plain wrong. I stand with our Muslim neighbors, friends, and allies and against bigotry and hate.

This week the House Judiciary Committee moved forward a dangerous bill that will override state laws and lower standards for who can carry concealed firearms. This legislation would severely undermine the progress Oregon has made to protect communities from dangerous people carrying hidden, loaded guns in public. House Republicans are trying to pass this concealed carry reciprocity legislation quietly, but I’m standing up for the safety of our communities. #EndGunViolence #StopCCR

Protecting the environment for future generations includes cleaning up sites contaminated with hazardous substances. Today the House passed strong bipartisan legislation to give communities in NW Oregon and across the country the resources they need to clean up sites and prepare them for future development or conservation.
On #WorldAIDSDay, I’m recognizing the advances in medicine & education that are slowing the spread of HIV & recommitting to continue the work. #EndAIDS2030.

Senate Republicans just rushed through the partisan #GOPTaxPlan. This hastily-written bill will cut rates for wealthy corporations and billionaires but harm education and lead to tax increases for millions of working families. We need a tax code that leads to a better future for Americans, with better jobs and better wages. The tax code should grow the economy and address income inequality – not make it worse.

The education provisions in the tax plan threaten students, colleges and universities, research and science, and U.S. innovation and global competitiveness. This will have negative consequences for years – or even decades – to come.  Read more in my post on Medium.

For struggling student loan borrowers, income driven repayment plans are a lifeline to affordable payments. My bipartisan, commonsense SIMPLE Act makes it easier to enroll in these plans and keeps working families out of default. Thank you The New York Times Opinion Section for recognizing this work. I hope we can get this bill through Congress quickly.

There is no good reason to delay passing the DREAM Act. Dreamers, like second grade teacher Daniel, are giving back to their communities and need DACA protections to stay in the only country they have ever known. I will continue to #ProtectDreamers and those with Temporary Protected Status, and fight for comprehensive immigration reform.

Oregon leads the nation in family-friendly workplace policies that provide workers with #PaidSickDays and predictable schedules. Family-friendly policies help businesses recruit and retain good, loyal employees, which decreases turnover. I spoke out today against a partisan effort that could eliminate and undermine sick leave policies for #WorkingFamilies in Oregon and around the country.

The humanitarian crisis in Burma must be brought to an end. Today the House passed a resolution I cosponsored calling for additional assistance to #Rohingya refugees and sanctions on those responsible for human rights abuses. It also calls on Burma's government and military to take steps toward a long-term solution. I will continue to advocate on behalf of Rohingyas until they achieve lasting peace and security.
Thank you to our brave firefighters who are battling the fires in Los Angeles. #SoCalFires

About 80,000 children in Oregon get care through the Children’s Health Insurance Program, and almost 11,000 Dreamers are working and studying in our state. They need certainty about their futures, not another harmful government shutdown. Instead of reauthorizing CHIP, protecting our Dreamers, and passing a long-term funding bill, the House majority passed another short-term spending bill. Governing crisis to crisis is bad policy. This shortsighted two-week funding bill is no way to responsibly fund our government. We must do better.

December 15 is the deadline to enroll in health insurance coverage through the exchange. By visiting www.healthcare.oregon.gov you may find a plan that works better for you and your family, or one that costs less. #GetCovered

The current #GOPTaxPlan will have long-lasting, harmful effects. I’m leading the effort to stand up for public education and have called on Congressional leaders to fix the bills’ harmful effects on education. We stand for more equitable access to quality K-12 education, more support for educators, and more affordable and accessible higher education.

EPA Administrator Pruitt suggests that we need a “red team, blue team” debate about whether humans contribute to climate change. No we don’t. What we need is a science-based discussion about how to address the threat of climate change. I have called for Administrator Pruitt to testify before the Science Committee to answer questions about his questionable anti-environment positions, including this one.

Along with all Oregonians, I mourn the passing of Vera Katz. Vera was a true leader, and a pioneer for women in politics. Portland and Oregon are better because of Vera’s leadership and legacy. She will be missed.

The House Committee on Education and the Workforce is working on updating federal #highered policies. As written, this partisan bill makes college more expensive for low-income students and working families, undermines consumer protections for student loan borrowers, eases protections for victims of sexual assault on college campuses, and lets for-profit institutions get federal funds with little accountability. Follow along on Twitter (@RepBonamici) as I offer amendments that #standwithstudents. Tune in live here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c13k9DZ62N0

I’ve heard from thousands of Oregonians about the need to protect #NetNeutrality. We must keep the internet open and fair. I urge the Federal Communications Commission to make the right decision and not repeal net neutrality.

As a mom and policy maker, I know kids need health coverage. It’s inexcusable that Congress let the Children’s Health Insurance Program, or CHIP, expire months ago. We must quickly renew and fully fund #CHIP to make sure children in Oregon and across the country have access to health care.
Over the holiday season, many servicemembers are away from their loved ones. I took time today to send them greetings of thanks with my colleagues Rep Mimi Walters and Joe Wilson.

Five years ago, horrific acts of gun violence at Clackamas Town Center and Sandy Hook Elementary School shocked our country and our state. Gun violence robs families of the opportunity to spend time with loved ones. But what continues to break our collective hearts is that the country has done so little to stop gun violence. #HonorwithAction

Time is running out to sign up for health care on Oregon Health Insurance Marketplace! Visit www.healthcare.oregon.gov and you might find a plan that works better for you and your family, or one that costs less. #GetCovered

Oregonians value higher education, and I am committed to making college affordable and accessible. The Republican proposals on taxes and federal #HigherEd policies would move us in the wrong direction. Today I heard concerns from students and higher education leaders about these partisan bills, which will make college more expensive for low-income students and working families, undermine consumer protections for student loan borrowers, and take away accountability over for-profit institutions.

When I talk with Oregonians about the opioid crisis, one thing I hear is that we need to stop opioid pills from getting into the wrong hands. Yet an investigation found that a major drug manufacturer failed to report suspicious orders, and the Drug Enforcement Administration weakened the fine and allowed the manufacturer to continue distributing drugs. That’s unacceptable. I’m supporting bipartisan legislation to restore the DEA’s ability to respond to the growing #OpioidCrisis (HR 4073).

I voted against the partisan tax plan because it will increase taxes on millions of families and workers while delivering enormous, unnecessary benefits and loopholes to wealthy corporations and billionaires. The #GOPTaxPlan is reprehensible and the wrong direction for our country.

The Newberg-Dundee Bypass will ease congestion for Yamhill County residents and visitors, as well as make it easier for wine and agricultural industries to move their goods to market. I was proud to support this important project in the Oregon Legislature and then continue my advocacy for it in Congress.

The House’s stopgap spending measure is unacceptable. Instead of this three-week funding bill, we should be focused on providing secure funding for our children’s health care and long-term security for our Dreamers. We have a responsibility to protect the most vulnerable. It is shameful that Congressional leaders spent time giving tax breaks to the wealthy and then rushed home without addressing the needs of vulnerable children and #Dreamers.

Public health decisions should be “science-based” and “evidence-based.” Period. It’s unacceptable to limit scientific inquiry or censor public documents, yet recent reports suggest the #CDC asked employees to refrain from using seven words. I demand that #CDC leadership answer for their actions.

In the United States no one is above the law. As we learn more about multiple contacts between Russians and the Trump campaign, Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s investigation is more important than ever. I joined with 171 Members to call on Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein to demand that Mueller’s investigation be allowed to continue without political influence or threats.

Hearing directly from people I represent, by call, letter, email, or attending a town hall meeting, is important to me and informs my decisions. Thank you to everyone who took the time to reach out in 2017. I truly appreciate hearing from you.
